Reviews.Title: “Our Boston Trip”
Reviews.Author: vegasgirl777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn on Tudor Wharf in February 2012. My husband and a couple of our friends were going to see a Boston Celtic game. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They helped us with room service in the middle of the night and taxi service to go out on the town. There was a short walk to TD Garden and some local bars were down the street. There is a short walk to a ferry that took us to the aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: bjreimann
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a conference and wanted a hotel with a kitchen and a little more room. We found the Residence Inn more than met our needs! We loved the location - far enough from the craziness of the city, yet close enough to jump on the subway and/or walk into the center. Some of the furniture is in need of an update - the dresser in one of the rooms had a broken bottom drawer and the bathtub had some nasty speckled stains. Overall, we were very happy and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time, would absolutely go back”
Reviews.Author: Jerseylili
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the rate. It was a last minute trip and we wanted to get away for a few days. The prices we were finding were very high, until we came across this hotel $259 a night. However, after pet fees and all different kinds of taxes it was $1000.00 for 3 nights. That being said, it was dog friendly so we got to bring our dog. They were very accommodating and so friendly. They even recommended a great take out place the night we decided to dine in. The hotel room itself was more like a little apartment. We didn't use the stove much but the refrigerator came in very handy. I thought the location was great, we were just across the water from the North end of Boston. The ferry was only a 5 minute walk and took you all the way downtown for $1.70 each way. We mostly walked everywhere and were always so happy to come back to our hotel room which felt more like home and rest our feet.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: dczhw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a sports group consisting of 14 people, and the staff were always accommodating, helping us out with where to go, how to get there etc. Always a smile and never felt too much trouble. The rooms are fabulous - we were all upgraded which was a lovely surprise, and had a separate bedroom with a huge bed (and the ensuite bathroom) and a living room area with a microwave, dishwasher and fridge freezer, plus a small dining table, crockery and cutlery. The minmarket downstairs sells hot pockets, bagel bites etc and the hotel will bring you in groceries on request. It's a great place to save money on food - it's a mini home. The swimming pool was lovely and warm with a nice view/outlook, a whirlpool etc and they let us in before we could check in which again was kind of them. I would stay here without hesitation if I was coming to Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...average Residence Inn.”
Reviews.Author: DirtyBedspread
Reviews.Content: The decor is pretty standard but the room seemed slightly smaller than most other Residence Inns. Service was good. The oven in my room was filthy, and the bathroom shower tile needs to be retiled...or demolded. The pool area was a little uncared for...the tile floor was dirty, with clumps of hair everywhere, and there were used towels left on the floor and furniture when the pool room was empty.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely practical and hassle free place”
Reviews.Author: Mridulmishra
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a business trip for around 2.5 weeks and liked the overall stay. The staff is very friendly and always available. The check in and checkout processes are absolute smooth. The breakfast and light dinner options are quite varied and useful. I personally liked the location because it was easy to reach north station, TD garden and Quincy market. It's walk able to downtown etc. The Wi-Fi also works lot easier than those places with changing passwords/. The only thing which I possibly felt a bit awkward was the crowd on breakfast specially over weekend. It was very tough to find a seat but in a way that shows the popularity of the place. Overall it's a great option to stay in Boston .

Reviews.Title: “Always love Residence Inns!”
Reviews.Author: MHCNH
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy staying at Residence Inns for the value. The free breakfast buffet saves a lot of money in an expensive city like Boston. If you stay during the week (which sadly, we never do) you also have a free light dinner/munchies each night. This is a great location for walking over to the North End of Boston. Small pool, but the kids love getting to swim in the winter while looking out the glass walls to the snow and bundled up passersby. Nice to have your own kitchen too. Overall very nice property, and we visit often.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room size”
Reviews.Author: Richard Y
Reviews.Content: Wonderful breakfast selection. Convenient to north end. Friendly employees. Nice pool. Felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable,basic, could use a little updating, 10 minute walk to the "t"”
Reviews.Author: fogsmom
Reviews.Content: We spent New years eve here and had a comfortable stay in a one bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and a separate living room Kitchen with full size fridge, microwave and stove Beds were comfortable, but carpet a little worn and showing seams and upholstery on the furniture quite dingy Free wifi is a plus as is the location on the water - but a good 10-15 minute walk to the closest subway station - fine during the day, but less interesting after a night out Hot breakfast in the am pretty standard and fine Lobby is nice with a fireplace Exercise room faces the rising sun and no shades so prepare to squint as you use the treadmilll Does have an indoor pool no one had emptied the trash from the previous guests which was sort of yucky to have to deal with

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: RedRoverDoncaster
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a very good location. Slightly out of the centre but walk able to all parts of the city. Family room was excellent with separate lounge / kitchen. Ideal for families of all ages. Best way into the centre is via the little ferry boat near USS Constitution. Walk over the bridge was also convenient. No noticeable noise from the bridge and great views. The hotel also put on free evening snacks and soft drinks.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time we've stayed here- and we'll stay here again when we come back!”
Reviews.Author: photographerNichols
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an incredible bargain for the perfect location at the end of the historic trail. The rooms are perfectly kept, and the staff is incredibly helpful. Only about a 2 minute walk from the site of the Bunker Hill memorial and Old Ironsides, the location is ideal for sightseeing. It's also about a 5-minute walk from the Bruins arena in case you wanna catch a hockey game. The harbor view rooms are amazing in the morning when the cannons are fired from the USS Constitution- you can see and hear them with the windows open(but it's far enough away that you can't hear them if the windows are closed). It's also about a 10 minute walk from the best Italian food in the Northeast! We can't wait to go back again and stay here a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Choice for the Boston Area”
Reviews.Author: Stealthray
Reviews.Content: Convenient location to downtown Boston and local historical attractions. Rooms are available to accomidate larger families. The breakfast was decent and well stocked, but the seating area was insufficient to handle the crowds. One note of caution - the adjacent bridge into Boston sits about 75 meters away and parallel to the third floor of the hotel on the north side. It has lots of traffic, both foot and vehicle. The noise from the bridge is not bad, but for enhanced privacy request a room above the third flood.

Reviews.Title: “Simple easy convenient”
Reviews.Author: stylematters
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location especially if you enjoy city walks .It a delightful place to stay close to the USS Constition and a 1.5 mile walk to the North End of Boston and Fanuil Hall. Coffee shops, bars ,churches and restaurants are a few steps away.The hotel has a really cool pier overlooking the Charles River. The hotel the staff is very friendly .The lobby has a lovely fireplace which is a perfect place to plan or review your adventures through Boston.The breakfast buffet is amazing. While the coffee is not the best ,the choice of breakfast foods is extensive and it tastes pretty good. Some of the rooms are a bit worn but very clean and the suites are a great option for families. The refrigerator ,stove ,small table and chairs and pull out couch make it easy for a family to stay together. We visited this hotel twice in two months and we really did feel at home and are looking forward to visiting again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Okay experience, great service, location not that central”
Reviews.Author: Mumbaiwalli
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. We had a pleasant stay there, and although there was an issue with our room the second day, it was taken care of by the front desk staff and housekeeping staff very efficiently at once. We really appreciated the attention our issue got. I thought the location could've been better, but that was also our fault, as we didn't look into this as closely as we should have. From Tudor Wharf to Prudential it is quite a stretch, especially with two small kids by foot. The sea view from our room was breathtaking. The breakfast was very nice, the staff was extremly attentive to our kids, thanks folks, this is something we rarely experience in Europe, and our kids felt instantly at home! All in all a good experience, although wouldn't suggest the location to people with kids who'd like to walk with them, as we had to take a cab at least to get back to the hotel a couple of times with overtired kids not in the mood to walk 30mins home...

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sweeti4027
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a concert and had a pleasant stay. Clean and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Waterview and within walking distance to many things!”
Reviews.Author: Scamp2011
Reviews.Content: Did a weekend getaway with the kids for an early family Christmas gift. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable.The hot breakfast was great (included in stay). They have an indoor pool that is a little on the small size, but in Boston you're luck to have a pool and the kids (if any) will enjoy it! Staff was helpful. Parking can be a challenge if you don't use the valet, but that's a problem no matter where you go in Boston. 15 minute walk to the North End or TD Garden. Qiuncy Market is about a 20 minute walk and the Boston Common or New England Aquarium are both about 25 minutes away. The T (subway system) is nearby if you don't want to walk to the attractions. The waterview give you the view of Boston Harbor and if in a upper floor you can see the upper half of the USS Constitution and the Tobin bridge. The other side of the hotel will give you a view of TD Garden an the Zachem Bridge. This is a hotel I would recommend especially in the summer time.

Reviews.Title: “Third time we've stayed here and we still love it”
Reviews.Author: cab514
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel has become a holiday tradition for my family. We have family in the Boston area and were looking for a good hotel at a decent price when we first came here three years ago. We loved it then and we love it now. We arrived rather late (10 pm) and were greeted with a smile and an upgrade to two queen sized beds (instead of one king). My daughter was thrilled to be able to sleep on a bed instead of the sleeper sofa. Loved having a fridge in our room and thought we would use the little stove (but didn't this time around). Room was clean and spacious - it was nice to be able to spread out in the living room to visit with our cousins. Breakfast buffet was slightly different the two mornings we ate there. Nice selection of hot and cold food. It did get a bit crowded around 9:30 or so - breakfast ended at 10. Valet parking a bit pricey ($35/night) but convenient. We are planning on staying here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice alternative to staying in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ryebeach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a 3 day "getaway" and was very happy. It is an extemely walkable distance to some great dining in Charlestown, our very quiet room looked out on to Old Ironsides, the included breakfast buffet had a nice selection of breakfast items with friendly attendants and the valet parking was as easy as could be for in and out exploring Cambridge and Boston. Some drawbacks are that room service is not available - but with the small kitchen we were able to keep plenty of beverages and snacks on hand for down time in the room - and it is a hike for a T stop, but I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Unique Location”
Reviews.Author: FederalFarmer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family (I usually travel for business). Staff was very friendly and helpful. Good local knowledge of attractions and transportation options. They offer nice breakfast buffet options. The only downside could be the location; the hotel is in Charlestown (which has some charming streets). This puts the hotel a little far from most Boston attractions, especially for families with small children. I plan to stay here on my next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: twinmommy1
Reviews.Content: This location is very close to Massachusetts General Hospital and thats why we stayed there. It was a very clean and updated hotel and breakfast was included. Thats a great buy especially when you bring the kids. Wifi was free, parking was expensive. Overall a great choice, not the best though if you want to be in the very heart of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Judytraveler13
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Boston and wanted to see all the history the area has to offer! The Inn was the perfect location to do our sight-seeing and to have great places to eat in....all in walking distance. The room we had was very good...our only complaint was that the spotlights were shining in on us so the draped needed to be closed once they came on. The fitness center could use a bench for lifting. The meals that they provide were great and the help took pride in what they served!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Idaho_hick
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, as we have come to expect from Marriott. Only complaints are the price (but Boston is not a cheap city) and no restaurant/lounge on site. Location was great!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: BVMonroe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was expensive, but not as expensive as many others in the area. We had a wonderful view of the Charles River. Our room was large and comfortable; very clean and quiet. Hotel staff was helpful in assisting us with directions throughout the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: JeneZ
Reviews.Content: First, let me start off by saying I had a smaller "studio" room, right next to the elevator which had a view of the freeway -- and it was still one of the best hotel experiences ever. First, you can take the water taxi from the airport to the back door (dock) of the hotel. Second, the gracious staff allowed a very early check in which made ALL the difference in my 4 day, 3 night Halloween vacation (which just happened to include a good Nor'easter storm). I was concerned with the location, however, a short walk to the North Station T will connect you to all of the city. The bonus of being right on the water and the Freedom Trail more than makes up for the short walk over the locks. My room was exceptionally clean, and a perfect size. It was great having the fridge and microwave for leftovers. Extremely quiet, windows open just enough to get some fresh air and determine outside tempeature. The breakfast was exceptional and changed a little each morning. I am so glad I stayed here and will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepezee in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Derek B
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience of a Residence Inn and it won't (hopefully!) be our last. As others have said this hotel is ideally placed for those who are in Boston to site see and especially for those who don't mind a little walking. Approx 20 mins to City centre. This property is actually on the famous 'Freedom Trail' and also has quick access to the water taxi for a novel way to access the City sites. Very comfortable beds and slept as we wouild at home. We had a small 'problemette' with our first room ( not really the hotels fault) which was immediately resolved by the helpful front desk staff who offered a change of room even though the hotel was very full.(Thank you Dottie!) Shame about the 'non green' plastic eating kit for meals - but hey the breakfast was included so what the ............we are on holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this "home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: FerrisXL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights during our recent trip through New England and just loved it! This Residence Inn is conveniently located (North End and Downtown at walking distance), the rooms are very spacious, well-equipped (including fridge with freezer, microwave oven, dishwasher etc) and comfortable and we had a fantastic view over the waterfront which was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful, too, and the atmosphere in the hotel good and relaxed. Price-wise, this hotel compares positively with others in expensive Boston, so quality/price relationship was very good. Breakfast was good and varied. The only thing which we did not like is the use of plastic plates and cutlery - not very classy and not environmentally friendly. The hotel has valet parking which is very convenient. We will definitely consider staying again in this "home away from home" when in Boston the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ldarch
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long girls' weekend. Was a little afraid from the map that it would be too far to walk, but it's a very walkable distance from many attractions and the North End. Also convenient short walk to the T. It's clean and well decorated and the staff was so very helpful with dinner recommendations and other suggestions. The breakfast is standard Residence Inn fare, which is fine, and they do offer a large variety of hot and cold dishes. They offered evening refreshments as well, but we did not partake -- too busy. The beds were exceptionally good -- slept every bit as well as I do at home. Overall a good stay and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with Marriott points”
Reviews.Author: originalmissscarlett
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay and was very pleased to be treated as a valued guest instead of an unwelcome cost of doing business because we used our Marriott points. This is not always the case and sometimes we receive the lowest level of accommodations even when hotels are not full. We had a lovely room quite large by Boston standards within walking distance of the North End. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Breakfast was included too. Highly recommend and will stay there again even without points.

Reviews.Title: “incompetent over busy staff”
Reviews.Author: sue1054
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the residence inn & the hotel was very good but do feel quite strongly about a couple of issues. The reception staff (only some of them) were too busy to pay you any attention or answer your queries properly. There was only 1 member of staff at the desk at lunch time when it is the busiest time as people were checking out, she was trying to check out ,check people in & answer the phone so it was impossible to do it right. People were leaving cases & she was not giving any receipts out as she clearly was trying to do 5 jobs at once so when i came back for my luggage it had gone no one knew where as i was not given a receipt. It was found in a store cupboard minus any identificationj. Also the breakfast was excellent but how sad that it was served on plastic plates etc using plastic cutlery come on Marriott you can do better than that

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: gooddog6
Reviews.Content: Room suite was small and was apparently a pet friendly room and our allergies were horrendous! Nice location. Great walk into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, smoke free and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: wepagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July for a mini getaway to boston and we were not dissapointed! We love having the small apt feel. Clean and smoke free is what we always look for and this fit the bill. Comfy beds, flat screen tvs in bedroom and living room a big plus! Nice views of the harbour. The complimentary full hot breakfast was great. The location was just right. Away from the hustle and bustle of downtown but not too far. My sister even got a free blackberry charger from the front desk, left behind by a previous traveler. They had 2 boxes full of chargers! Good to know since this is something people forget to pack sometimes. Parking is a bit far and pricey. Overall we were satisfied with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Almost like a Little Apartment overlooking the River”
Reviews.Author: everymilesamemory
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Residence Inn overlooking the Boston Harbor for 3 nights in September 2011. Checking in, I was a little worried that we were on the opposite side of the bridge from the main part of the Downtown Area were all the action is. We'd later thank ourselves for this. #1, it kept the noise of the city down considerably. #2 it gave us a reason to get in a morning walk or an after dinner cool down walk after we'd eat at one of the restaurants in town. The Freedom Walk Trail is right in front of the motel and you have both Bunker Hill and the USS Ironsides within view of the front of the motel The room was more like a small apartment with a king bedroom that had a huge television in front of the very comfortable bed. Pillows and Sheets were both top notch! The living room had a fold out couch, a computer table, a small kitchen table, another huge TV and a small kitchen with a full sized refrigerator that saved us from having to eat every meal out at a restaurant. We didn't really interact with the staff other than having to check in and out so I cant really comment on them, but when ever we saw them in passing, they were always cordial. Our view out the window was stellar. It overlooks a nice marina with beautiful boats to gawk at. One night was a full moon and watching it rise over the Boston Harbor was pretty unforgettable. One word to guests checking in. If you're room faces the USS Ironsides, keep your curtains closed in the morning for the rising sun will blind you or wake you up if you want to sleep in Parking in the Marina parking will also save you some money. Valet should have been $35 per night, but parking in the Marina for 3 days only costs us $25 total.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place by the water.”
Reviews.Author: Domi0411
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in a 2 bedroom-suite. The suite was spacious and clean, with 2 king beds,2 bathrooms and a great view of Boston and the Charles River The staff was ok without being extremely friendly. The complimentary breakfast is great and even when the breakfast area is crowded, empty trays are promptly replaced by full ones. The location is nice by the water and the hotel is on the Freedom Trail. We stayed there in August and a short walk through the Paul Revere park and over the locks brought us to the North End in 5 minutes. Probably this stroll isn't that nice during the cold season or in the rain. For families with kids and dog owners: the park, next to the hotel, has a nice playground and it is a meeting place for people with dogs. If you don't mind walking, this hotel is a very good choice.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Me Time”
Reviews.Author: Pocahontas45
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Rewards member who likes the water, I chose to stay at this hotel based on Marriott rewards rep via phone. Be prepared that unless you go during the summer - there is nothing to do near this hotel location. Therefore, my stay was primarily in the hotel which offered a nice bar and nice ambience, I also ventured into town via cab to see a show. I was disappointed that my ocean view room was was blocked and not necessarily direct view of the water. The highlight of my stay was scheduling a body massage. As the hotel does not have an onsite spa, you can schedule to have personaliized spa treatments in your hotel from a local spa. This was an amazing experience. The masseuse was ontime and the body massage I had was outstanding. My checkout was extremely disappointing. I would reconsider staying here but only in the summer when it's nice to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal spot to stay in Charlestown , MA”
Reviews.Author: ericjf2
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is always very comfortable and we've been staying there many years on trips to visit our daughter in Charlestown. The breakfasts are scrumptious (although it's very easy to overeat and gain excess pounds). The only significant disadvantage is the very expensive parking at the hotel and without Massachusettes plates it's virtually impossible to park on the street without being ticketed. The hotel is close to the Bunker Hill (Breeder Hill) monument and Old Ironsides and this makes it's location idea.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: G L
Reviews.Content: One of the better Residence Inn hotels in the Marriott chain. Excellent location: convenient to Boston, North End (Little Italy) and Cambridge. Great breakfast. Excellent views of harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston hotel for families with little ones.”
Reviews.Author: carolinagirlinnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 18 month old and 3 year old. The one bedroom king room worked perfectly for our family. The kitchenette even had enough space for our pack & play so the little guy could have his own area. The location is requires some walking to get anywhere besides the USS constitution and harbor area, but that was ok for us. We enjoyed walking around the harbor area and seeing the boats. We even took our breakfast out there one morning. The breakfast also worked great for us and was the typical res inn spread. We made use of the inroom dishwasher and the coin-op laundry on our floor.

Reviews.Title: “At home in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Lamp2000
Reviews.Content: Our five night stay at the Marriott Residence Inn in Boston was the closest thing to being home and on vacation at the same time. Having a kitchenette and separate bedroom/living area was wonderful, then adding the view of the harbor made it an all around Wow experience. The location is perfect for all the sights, the public transportation is excellent, and the hotel staff were all friendly and helpful during a busy time. If we are in Boston again, we will certainly stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Liltraveler47
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Boston on a family trip and stayed at the Residence Inn Boston Harbor. Just wanted to let anyone considering staying here to please stop hesitating and book this hotel. It is a great place to stay when traveling with family as you get a complete kitchen (even including a mini dishwasher) and the rooms are more like a little one-bedroom apartment than a hotel. Its location is also excellent located at the end of the Liberty Trail walk. So you can either take the subway or a taxi to Boston Common and begin your walk ending up where your hotel is situated or you can do the walk backwards. You are a 5 minute walk from the Constitution and a 5 to 10 minute walk to the North End for great Italian restaurants and Gelato (yum!) Enjoy your stay in Boston! It really is a great city and the people are always very nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem/Great Location/ best Value in Town!”
Reviews.Author: FinnieF
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in August and I am coming back for sure! This is a no frills Marriott, an amazingly great value, a short walk to the North End, Rose Kennedy Greenway and Fanuel Hall. The staff was fam Ntastic and the condo like feel makes it like a nice vacation home. He breakfast and evening snacks were great! I can't say enough for this place and I am usually a hotel snob staying in Five star hotels. Dog owners-- there is an awesome dog park right next door!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Christine H
Reviews.Content: The room and location were fine. The concern was the poor signage for parking and lack of explanation of parking availability. Car was towed - understand it was our fault for parking in the wrong place - but signage was confusing and we came in at night. Response from tow company is that this happens all the time. Response from desk was worse...we can't be expected to tell all the guests checking in about the parking. If this is a regular problem - doesn't seem as if taking an additional 20 sec to explain the parking would be a problem if your focus is on the customer experience. Left a very bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: goldsmanh
Reviews.Content: King Suite with good sized rooms for our family of 5, extremely friendly staff, walking distance to North STation T stop. Great breakfast, several (free) dinners. Beautiful spacious lobby. Would not bring a car here (too expensive). Walking distance to Bunker Hill monument (about 15 minutes) and the USS Constitution.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: mar0883
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, especially since it's so close to the North End, which is right across the bridge. Also very convenient to the T and not a bad walk to the duck boat tours. The room was comfortable, the beds very comfortable. 5 of us stayed in a suite with no problem, not that we were there much with so much to do in the city. If I have to register any complaint, it's that there is nowhere near enough seating for the breakfast buffet, and seemingly no matter what time it was. The tables were constantly full, and many people were seen taking food to their rooms, likely because they had no choice. This really needs to be remedied.

Reviews.Title: “A nice choice”
Reviews.Author: hscohn
Reviews.Content: While it is a bit of a schlep from the subway line, it is pretty close to central Boston, has reasonably sized rooms, a little indoor pool, regular food offerings and is decently price.

Reviews.Title: “A high priced "motel" with little to no customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Mghoffy
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is an embarrassment to the chain. As a frequent traveler and a Marriott elite level customer it is clear this property and it's personnel have been ignored. The hitelis dirty, the beds are horrible, most items in the rooms are broken or un disrepair and the staff, all of them and consistently, the rudder and least helpful I have encountered. Truly out of character for this chain. A huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good...but be sure to get a room on the east side of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewTO
Reviews.Content: I can't complain, really, as I got a last-minute deal here via Priceline. The hotel is everything you'd think a hotel in its price range would be: super clean, super efficient, friendly. The complimentary breakfast alone would cost you $25 if you had to pay for it; a real feast! Very roomy. If you do stay, book a room on the east side of the hotel. Why? On the west side, the lights are a-blazing 24/7 (curtains effectively blocked the light), and there is a view of the highway next door, ie, you'll hear it. There IS free parking immediately on the west side of the hotel, but there are only about 20 spots; I was quite lucky to get one. Otherwise, you'll have to pay $32 overnight valet, which is exorbitant, I think, by any standard.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch Residence Inn and friendly staff. A best choice for family travel to Boston.”
Reviews.Author: 4BaySailors
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the week leading up to the July 4 celebration for five nights using accumulated Marriott Rewards points for a family vacation in Boston. First, the staff: On arrival, we met Geraldine at the front desk and felt like we would be "at home" all week. I almost hate mentioning people by name because EVERY staff member all week in this hotel was first-rate and I don't remember any other names!!. Geraldine just set the stage for us to be impressed. I regret not remembering the names of the five or six folks who staffed the breakfast area throughout the week. The hotel was VERY full and lots of international travelers were at breakfast each morning. It was hectic and there were many special requests. The staff never failed to smile; always appeared "out of nowhere" when you needed help or your child spilled while serving himself from the buffet; and to boot, one sweet staffer kept appearing with little party treats for the kids. These were penny/party store plastic trinkets but my kids were tickled to death to be treated so specially. I cannot stress enough how calm, friendly and professional the staff are here. One of my children had an accident in the night and was mortified we had to call the front desk for clean-up help early in the morning. Not only did the woman at the desk calmly dispatch clean linens and the friendliest of housekeeping representatives, she offered to send up a treat for my daughter. Bravo for probably the best Marriott staffing we've encountered anywhere . . . and we almost always stay in Marriotts. Location: FABULOUS. Our rooms faced the spectacular modern Bunker Hill bridge and a vista of both center city and Cambridge buildings beyond. We were in #818 and grandparents were next door in #816. LARGE, clean rooms. Perfect view -- even if the view toward the Harbor would have been better. We went to the USS Constitution park area each morning (a 5 minute walk ) and either jumped on a bus or into a taxi to start our sightseeing day. We could have hailed cabs right at the hotel . . . but the Constitution is such a gorgeous ship, my hubby, my father, and my son all wanted to start their days under its impressive masts. Note: I never thought I'd recommend any trolley tour company in any city . . . but we used Upper Deck/Super Tours two-day ticket and saw all of Boston and Cambridge with really knowledgeable drivers. Traveling with grandparents and small kids, this tour option was a LIFESAVER and helped us decide where we wanted to visit during the rest of our week. Note: If you're a city dweller used to walking everywhere, this hotel is hugely walkable to most of Boston tourism hotspots. It sits ON the Freedom Trail. My husband and I loved walking to the North End Italian restaurants several different evenings. Crossing the Charlestown Bridge was fun on foot . . . in June. I can imagine it's pretty brutal in the winter or in a rainstorm, so plan accordingly. Take some time to just relax and enjoy the hotel's "grounds". How often do you stay in a hotel built on a wharf, surrounded by gorgeous pleasure boats with a great small city skyline?? FOOD: The breakfast was wonderful each day. Many good, healthy choices and lots of sunny places to sit, both inside and out. The hotel is in an area where you have to walk just a bit, but there are many great spots for food. We had a delightful evening in Max and Dylan's City Square (the original is near the theatre district in the city). It's newer, sleek, and serves great food with attentive, fun staff. They accommodated a party of six LATE on a Sunday night. We closed the place down but were never rushed or made to feel we needed to leave. This is the closest restaurant to the hotel (less than one block) and we really enjoyed it. PARKING: What do you expect from a hotel in any city? $30+ is a bargain in NYC and is on par with Philly and DC. We enjoyed peace of mind so it was worth the $$. DOG OWNERS: We regret not bringing our dog. There is a fabulous dog park (looks like a dog Mecca each morning and dinnertime!) just under the Charlestown Bridge from the hotel. OVERALL: This hotel epitomizes what Residence Inns were designed to do: create home away from home for families and professionals on extended stays. All four of us give it a big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: Torontotraveller2
Reviews.Content: Wife and I were in Boston for the annual Harborfest. Residence Inn seemed a good choice for people who wished to be near the water--near Old Ironsides for her annual sailabout on 4th July, etc.--and we were more than satisfied, being able to view Old Ironsides plus a good deal more of Boston's harbor action just from our room. Front Desk, breakfast and housekeeping staff exceptionally pleasant and helpful. Breakfast excellent and "Managers Reception" better than many such...though no booze. Hard to come up with a complaint but I found the lack of a phone book, even a hardcopy listing of TV channels and local guide, inconvenient. Apparently decision been made to put all such info ONLINE. But: TWO hardcopy Holy Bibles found in room! Would rather have the phone book and the TV listing, thank you very much. Two bus lines to downtown pass nearby, plus just five minute walk to the free--with transit pass--MBTA water shuttle to downtown. I found some Tripadvisor reviews confusing on the walk to North Station, so will try to clarify. You can walk over the bridge right next to the hotel at all times of day and night and the MBTA North Station is about 10-15 minutes away. There is also a rather poorly-marked walkway route to North Station that follows the more interesting path over the Charles River locks, maybe a few minutes shorter. But perhaps not recommended after dark or if transporting luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Thubner
Reviews.Content: The pros of this hotel are many: large room, fabulous harbor view, fine service from front desk and car valet, good value despite high $35 daily parking charge, and a surprisingly good hot breakfast. The only con is the location at the former Navy Yard in Charlestown. About a 15 minute walk to the "T" at North Station or a cab ride to get anywhere. Only one good restaurant within walking distance, but several only a 5 minute drive away in the North End. But even the location has positive aspects: beautiful, quiet surroundings in an historic setting far from the chaos of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Unless you have a car...”
Reviews.Author: zaqxswcde
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel shows up in most hotel sites as located in Cambridge area, it's actually within walking distance from the old town and downtown Boston. It's located right next to USS Constitution and has a great view of the Boston harbor. The only inconvenience of this hotel would be parking, which costs $32 per day for valet at the hotel. There is a public parking right in front which costs $22 per day (outdoor, 1 min walking distance) and an indoor parking which cost $20 per day(3 min walking distance). Everything else other than parking is great! Every room is a suite with fully equipped kitchen and they even do groceries for you if you stay long. One of the things that I liked most about this hotel is the complimentary breakfast which includes amazing self served waffles and English muffins. Be sure to try it if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “As Advertised-Good Hotel for Friends”
Reviews.Author: Blazin65
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just stayed at this hotel for a 3 day weekend. We enjoyed it, because we are just two guys that were there for the weekend to tear up the town and see everything there was to see. We did not want to fork out the money to stay in a plush hotel. This hotel fit what we were looking for: Full Breakfast, Refrigerator with Ice Maker, Close Proximity to Airport, Excellent Staff, Great Hot Tub. The only thing that was bad about this hotel was the beds. Just to hard or firm to be comfortable. But since everything else about this hotel was great, we didn't complain. We normally stay at Renaissance, so we are picky, and this place was acceptable. If you are a couple looking for somthing more romantic, you should proabably fork out the extra money to stay at the Marriott at Copley. Very nice bar at that hotel. Not to mention all the shopping and restaurants. I'm not sure about the rooms, but if I ever go back to Boston with a mate, I would be looking at the availability of that hotel. Just a few notes for like travelers: The liquor/beer and convenient store are about 5 blocks away, but very walkable. The subway is a 8 minute walk away. You can walk across the bridge or the quickest way is across the locks at the dam. I would recommend taking a cab or shuttle to the hotel when you arrive in Boston if you are not familliar with Boston. It's about $25. But on your departure, you can take the subway back for $2. Ask the staff for help about which subways to take (orange line then transfer to blue line. It's very doable. We made it from the hotel to the airport in 40 minutes on a Sunday. Also word of advice, take a rain jacket for very changeable weather. We did not, and it was a big mistake. Especially at night when we wanted to go out. Lines at bars are long. Overall we were pleased with this hotel I would have gave 5 stars if the beds were more comfortable. Just take a look at the map and make sure you are OK with walking across the river to the subway or other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, informal relaxing hotel with harbor view”
Reviews.Author: NatalieInternational
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent experience at the hotel. Had two unfortunate clumsy accidents in the bedroom and rang Reception and they came up straight away (literally within minutes). The hotel reception staff were very friendly and helpful, which really counts. The hotel is a little bit outside the main city and you need to walk across the bridge to get there. However I wouldn't say the walk was much of a problem. We got the hop-on-hop-off bus that goes from Stop 3 at USS Naval Yard, if you want to save your legs for the odd day. I liked that the hotel had a spa tub and swimming pool, so you can relax after a hard days sightseeing around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mixmasterg
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this clean and friendly place. Very comfortable we can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Johnny1986
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. The room was impecably clean and the thermostat control was very responsive. Had complimentary popcorn in the room as well as coffee and tea. Complimentary breakfast downstairs was divine, large selection of juices, milk, breads, cereals. Free wifi was very fast and responsive. Hotel location is 2 miles from the BCEC which was convenient for PAX East 2011. $10-$15 taxi ride to or from the convention center. Hotel is close to the trains which can be used to travel most of Boston worth seeing. You may need to walk a bit, and make sure you have your bearings or you may get a little lost. Overall, fantastic hotel, but don't make long distance calls unless you mean it. I called my cell phone to find it and it was a $6 call that lasted a few seconds. But that was really my fault for not thinking straight at 12am.

Reviews.Title: “A short stopover, added an extra night on check-in”
Reviews.Author: MikeAussie83
Reviews.Content: We were travelling around New England with our 2month old baby, the hotel was perfect, it had a kitchen and the rooms were comfy. The front desk staff were helpful and patient. The location is great, a short walk (in fine weather) or drive to all the sights downtown, except it was raining and alot of snow around. The rooms could do with some updating and the breakfast was about OK. But otherwise a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: beth8520
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 2 night get away in Boston with our 4 and 10 year old. When we arrived we were put in a room that had air freshener that had been sprayed in it and it was so offensive that I had a headache after 5 minutes and difficulty breathing. They were very good about changing us to another room right away and calling to check if the new room was alright. But, if there were other empty rooms why would they put us in that room? Also, as we were walking to our new room I saw the housekeeper with the little green fogger spraying another room with the same offensive odor. The rooms are small, we had a one bedroom suite and it was small and as others have said you could not walk around the bed once it was open. The decor and furniture is dated and could use an upgrade. The walls are very thin and you can hear everything at night when it is quite. My son had a hard time sleeping due to the noise from the other room. We were not in a harbor view room so we faced the highway side which was noisy at times. The air system in the room was loud so we left that on and it drowned out quite a bit of the noise. The pool and the health club are both very small but clean. Breakfast was very chaotic and there was poor placement of the breakfast items. It caused long waits just to get a cup of coffee. They need to move the waffle maker and toaster over to the hot area and the cereal over to the area with the coffee. It would greatly improve the traffic flow and there would not be people clustered around waiting for waffles or toast. No free coffee and tea throughout the day which we have always had at other Residence Inns we have stayed at. The front desk staff on the weekend were okay- certainly did not feel they went out of their way at all. The person at the desk when we checked out on Monady was very nice- I think it may have been a manager. As others have said it is a 10-15 minute walk to the North End and North Station. It was very cold and windy, we started walking across the bridge but the wind was too much for our 4 year old. I also would not want to walk alone there at night. We paid $149.00 per night which was a fair price but next time I would spend a bit extra and stay in Boston closer to transit and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: achen2_98
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I was travelling with wife and toddler. Found this hotel to be cheapest "suite" hotel near the downtown Boston area. I am sure the hotel is nice in the summer where you can walk everywhere. Full breakfast and friendly staff is one reason I would stay here again. Also free wifi, kitchen, and pool also helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - highly recommended for families”
Reviews.Author: charliesmum
Reviews.Content: Volcano Ash in April kept us in Boston 10 extra days - family with kids age 1 and 11. Stayed at Fairmont, Marriott Long Wharf and Radisson before settling at here. Without doubt the best value and location for extended family stay. Staff couldn't have been nicer, suite with kitchen was ideal with baby in tow. Loved walking into Charlestown and across bridge into the city, as well as strolling along to the naval yard, Free breakfast may not have been gourmet fayre, but was decent enough. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Next to the USS Constitution and the Bunker Hill Monument.”
Reviews.Author: mars2025
Reviews.Content: Great location with fun, complex geography--don't be afraid to take walks by the riverside and all around. That is part of the charm of this part of the world--my home city. The North End (Italian food) and North Station are just across the Charlestown Bridge. Free wifi in room, free hot breakfast. As with most of Boston, it is probably hopeless to try to park for free overnight, but there is 2-hour free parking nearby, *past* the hotel, after you go under the bridge, near a park. Gym and indoor pool. Kitchen and sofa bed in room. The room service was peculiarly half-baked. We had an excellent view of Boston's new, cable-stayed bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Nice Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: George40850
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston from Maine on Christmas via Amtrak. Stayed 2 nights. Five minute walk to hotel from North Station(TD Garden above) where we arrived on Amtrak. After a day or so we learned there was a walkway from the rear of the hotel under the Charles river bridge, thru Revere Park and over the Charles Rivers locks--directly to/from North Station, about 5 minute walk. Quick and easy and no traffic to cross. Boston subway also available at North Station. Complimentary breakfast was great! Hot oatmeal with various toppings, scrambled eggs/sausage/ham, bagels, make your own waffle, English muffins, cereal, yogurt fresh fruit, numerous hot and cold beverages. They also have free food evenings Mon-Thurs but we were not there to partake. Nice views of harbor and marina. Room clean and comfortable, a little small compared to other R.I.'s I've stayed at but fine for us. Small kitchenette with all amenities. Nice clean pool and hot tub. Exercise room was nice with TV's in front of each machine. Business room has free internet access via one PC. Lobby and breakfast area very nicely decorated and comfortable. Would stay here again at the right price. (We got advanced reservation rate and must be off-peak too because rate more than doubles in the summer.)

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: virgonomic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 friends after the Sens/Bruins game on 13-Nov. It is a short walk from the TD Garden. We got a King suite on hotels.com for $185. The room was spacious with a small kitchen that we didn't use. The breakfast buffet and wireless internet were included which was a great value. Parking for 24h was only $22 at the adjacent lot. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “good location; and quiet”
Reviews.Author: mshndv
Reviews.Content: The location, although not in Boston, but rather Charlestown; is terrific! You do have a 10-15 walk over the bridge to get to the subway station, but well worth it since "the T" is a great way to get around. The hotel is right along the Freedom Trail so there is plenty of foot traffic in the area to feel safe. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. The daily complimentary breakfast was definitely worth going to, with both hot and cold breakfast choices-- and you could eat outside along the wharf! All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very convienent location just over the bridge from downtown”
Reviews.Author: Hummingbird2905
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for the last Red Sox game of the season and stayed at the Residence Inn. This hotel is located just across the bridge from downtown and right on a marina. Our room was a corner suite with a terrific view. Although there is no restaurant at the hotel, they had a very nice complimentary breakfast every morning which was served buffet style. The food was surprisingly good - eggs, bacon, sausage, home fries...they even had a premeasured cup of waffle batter to make fresh waffles..It's just a short walk across the bridge to the train which will take you anywhere you need to go. My only complaint is the cost of parking = $32. a day and we didn't even use the car..it seems a little much but I think most of the area hotels charge the same....I would certainly stay here again especially in the suite which gives you room to move around and comes with a fully stocked kitchen area - microwave, coffee maker, stove, sink, dishes, small table w/ chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: ejdb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in early November 2010 on a business trip. The location is not very close to the T, but I took taxis which was fine (and there always seemed to be taxis lined up outside so you don't even have to have the front desk call one for you). The room was spacious and the front desk staff were very nice. I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised as New Englanders aren't exactly known for their welcoming manner, but the people working at this hotel were extremely polite and friendly. I have stayed at Residence Inns before, but this one was by far the nicest. Having breakfast included and free wifi is a nice bonus, too. I would stay here again if traveling to Boston for work.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the solo female traveler... Bad location and unconfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: solotravelar
Reviews.Content: Got a 100$/night rate with priceline. Honestly I really don't understand people saying "staff was beyond expectations". Check in and check out were 15 seconds literally, not even asked me if it was my first time in Boston, or if I need something or anything else. No smiles, courtesy or special attention. Just neutral. This was my first time at a residence inn, and probably my last. Next time I'll pay more and stay at a boutique hotel. If in Boston, probably the Lenox. Or anywhere downtown.... To get downtown from this Marriot you have to cross the bridge. It was raining and I was soaked as I walked back to the hotel (10-15 min "promenade"). I wouldn't cross this bridge in the dark, and even if Charlestown is charming it is quite deserted. I had to take taxis everyday... Having a kitchen is practical, but they could upgrade to flat screen tv's... We are in 2010. Bed was really unconfortable and pillows too ; duvet inappropriate to fall/winter season and the heater was actually a sort of fan. I live in Canada and I'm used to cold, but had to set the "heater" to 26 C degrees to bring some warmth to the room (and also some serious air current from the "heater"). The only good thing about this hotel was breakfas and spacious room. No, I can't recommend this hotel for the solo traveler, specially for women, unless you have a car or driver. I wouldn't stay there again (not even at a 100$ rate).

Reviews.Title: “Compassionate staff in our time of trouble”
Reviews.Author: bill_ferris
Reviews.Content: My Dad recently had to come down from Maine to Massachusetts General Hospital for some vascular heart sugery. My Mom, sister, brother in-law, and myself were able to get two rooms at The Marriott Residence for the expected 7-10 day hosptal stay. We were offered a VERY reduced rate for the rooms under a program for helping families/patients at MGH. The reduced rate still included full breakfast and all amenities. Unfortunately, everything that could go wrong with my Dad's surgical procedure did, and this vital man of 72 years eventually was removed from support measures and died the next day. When we returned to the hotel late that night, we advised the desk manager of our situation and were able to cancel the remainder of our reservation without penalty. Lisa also offered us as late of a checkout the next day as we needed. The angel then sent me and my brother in-law back to our rooms with several cold beers on the house. The next day as we were checking out, Lisa had returned for another shift and asked us if there was anything we needed. As my Mom made her way to the lobby to get in the car for the ride home, Lisa approached her and offered her condolences, and a gracious sympathy card. Yes the rooms were clean and well appointed. Yes the facilites were nicely decorated and located. Yes the reduced rate helped us a great deal. But the most important thing to my family was that the hotel was staffed by friendly and compassionate human beings. They truly cared.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - good location”
Reviews.Author: russrick
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Residence Inn Boston Harbor on Tudor Wharf was a great place to stay while we recently spent a 4-night weekend in Boston. While not â€œin the heart of townâ€� it did offer some other benefits, like quiet neighborhood, close to USS Constitution, and close to stop #3 on the Trolley Tour. Also, the front desk showed us a shortcut, walking along the locks over the river rather than the bridge which was very windy. It is, literally, 8 minutes to the Boston Garden, if youâ€™re lucky enough to have tickets for a Celtics or Bruins game. It was also less than a 30 minute walk to Boston Commons and 20 to the North End. Rooms could use a little TLC, with newer TVâ€™s and a better HVAC system, which was very noisy at times. Front desk staff was helpful with local places to grab a beer and sandwich â€“ check out Max & Dylanâ€™s, Warren Tavern, or Tavern on the Water (good appetizers and views), all less than 10 minutes walking distance. Nice breakfast buffet, which was crowded, but the staff managed it well. If flying into Boston, skip renting a car and pack your walking shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly room, moldy bathroom”
Reviews.Author: fogeo
Reviews.Content: Moldy bathroom. Bad smell in the kitchenette. Like a mouse died or something. Beds uncomfortable. Will not stay at a Marriott Residence Inn again. Especially for $175.

Reviews.Title: “The service at this hotel would make me come back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Cissyl
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston alone to sight see. I could not have been more pleased with this hotel. The service was outstanding, the staff (Lisa, especially )was very helpful assisting me with finding a way around the city as well as great places to eat and shop The complimentary breakfast was incredible too I road the Upper Deck trolley to see the sights & walk around the city. I also walked across the bridge to the North End a few times. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone I even took the Commuter Rail to Rockport to see the beach/ocean for a day - Spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Not Great for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: NJHB
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Marriott Residence Inn with standard amenities. However, tourists will find its location inconvenient. The hotel is located on the far side of the Charles River just over the Charlestown/Boston bridge. Public trnasportation is not readily available. It is about a mile walk one way to the nearest MTA (subway/train) stop at North Station, and a little further to the stop at Government Center. OK if you're in reasonable physical shape, but what about when it is raining, snowing, too hot or cold, etc? There is no taxi stand anywhere near the hotel. Cabs arrive sporadically, and the hotel desk will call a taxi for you, but at peak times and when the weather is inclement, the waits for a taxi will be long. This hotel is OK if you have a car, but most visitors to Boston don't (and shouldn't) have one. On our next visit to Boston, we will choose a hotel that is more conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with their customer service!”
Reviews.Author: mamacita97008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a reservation for a studio room and when we arrived at the hotel, they were overbooked for studios (there were two weddings going on when we arrived), so we were upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. The room was very nice and clean. The kitchen even had silverware, dishes, glasses, knives, pots and pans, and a dishwasher! The FREE morning breakfast was always yummy, with your choice of waffles you made fresh yourself, yogurt, toast, bagels, muffins, fruit, eggs, meat, cereal (both hot and cold), juice, and coffee. Also, during the week, they have either free food or reception. The hotel is across the Charles River from downtown Boston, but is easily walked in 10-15 minutes. It's also a five-ten minute walk to the Water Taxi that takes you to the Aquarium (and sites nearby, as well as a Metro stop). When you are downtown, you can easily either walk or take a subway to the Aquarium stop. If you're going to be in town for more than a couple days, be sure to buy the 7-day Link Pass ($15). It's good for unlimited travel on the bus, subway, and the water taxi (without a pass, it would have been $3.50 from the airport to the hotel, individual rides on the bus or subway are $2 each and the Water Taxi is $1.70 per ride, so you can see it's a great deal!). We purchased ours at the airport and used it to get into town (we took the Silver Airport bus inbound to the South Station, then caught the Red line to Downtown Crossing, walked upstairs, then around the corner to Franklin and Washington Streets, and caught the #93 bus that dropped us off at Chelsea and Warren Streets, a block and a half from the hotel.) There's supposedly a faster way to get there (using the Blue subway, but since we weren't yet acquainted with their subway system and this was the route suggested to us, we opted for it and it worked great!) We found the Link Pass to be a time saver (as well as keeping us from overtiring ourselves hiking everywhere), as it was easy to hop on a subway or bus to get between places that were quite a walk. And it was great taking the Water Taxi at the end of the day, as it was a calm, quiet, and serene way to end our day of sightseeing and it dropped us off a few blocks from the hotel. Even though the price was way higher than what we normally spend on hotels, Boston is an expensive town and the price was not out of line with other hotels. I would definitely recommend staying here! :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, quality, great location”
Reviews.Author: retiredndhappy
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to make the stay enjoable. Had trouble with our key card and the front desk staff was at our room within minutes! The continental breakfast was one of the best we've seen.The staff was always making sure all was well supplied and all tables were kept clean. Our room was delightful and the kitchen area had everything you'd require. The location is terrific! It is within walking distance to so much - downtown Boston, Bunker Hill, the North end, and Faniel Hall, just to mention some sites.The only suggestion I have is to possibly update the in room TVs. My family will be staying here whenever we visit the Boston area! Maybe next time we will have time to use the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for Freedom Trail”
Reviews.Author: familynavigator
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn on Tudor Wharf for two nights last month. It is at the far end of the Freedom Trail, across the bridge from the North End, near the Charlestown Navy Yard. So it is not right downtown but had much more reasonable rates than the downtown hotels I looked into. It was easy to walk the Freedom Trail backwards, starting at the USS Constitution, winding our way thru town, and ending at Boston Commons. Both nights we ate dinner near Faneuil Hall and then took a cab back ($10 incl tip). We could have walked but we were tired and it was getting dark. The hotel was typical Residence Inn -- clean, roomy, friendly staff. The room had a living room, bedroom, and tiny kitchen. Breakfast buffet was good -- more than just pastry and coffee -- there was cereal, eggs, etc. The eating area was quite full around 9:00, 9:30 a.m. on a Saturday, but it looked like you could take a tray back to your room. We just found an empty couch and balanced our plates. It was a quick cab ride to the airport for an early morning flight home. Overall, a very nice stay. Oh, and free wifi -- important for teens with electronics!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Chasswann
Reviews.Content: I've read several of reviews & wanted to add my 2 cents. This is the 2nd year in a row we've stayed in this location. We usually spend 1-2 nights in the Boston &/or Cambridge area en route to visit family in N. MA. I really do enjoy this location. Last year we spent a day touring the USS Constitution, climbed the Bunker Hill Memorial (its closed now for maintenance,) took the ferry to Fanueil Hall for dinner & went on the creepily fun Ghosts & Graveyard Tour. This year we spent the morning in Harvard Square over in Cambridge, came back & had lunch with the rest of our family, only a minute walk from the hotel in a very nice place mentioned in a previous review. We then took the ferry to Long Wharf, bought tickets for a tour of Fenway Park (highly recommended) then took the "T" to Fenway. Afterwards, we took the kids to "Tomb" near Fenway (they had a blast), then back to Fanueil Hall for dinner. Since the ferry service ends around 8 PM weeknites, we took cabs back to the hotel (less than $10.) The 1st evening, the front desk suggested 99's for dinner, a cheap, but good comfort food family restaurant (perfect after our long drive up from NJ for a light bite & fussy kids.) You do need a car to get here. Otherwise, they're several nice places in walking distance. If you drink, the mixed drinks looked generous & delicious. If you miss the hotel's breakfast buffet offering an array of hot/cold selections, there's a bakery/sandwich shop around the corner. BTW, don't miss Emack & Bollio's for ice cream, a great New England ice cream chain. I like being in this safe & picturesque area, you're definitely out of the hustle & bustle, and I found the room rates to be a lot cheaper than other locations in Boston. We stayed in a 1-bedroom suite. My big complaint for this room, when the sleeper sofa is open, its impossible to sit at the desk or even to get from one side of the bed to the other which you need to do to make it up with linens. The desk or sofa needs to be re-positioned. We found the front desk people to be entirely helpful, giving directions, calling tour companies for more information, suggesting restaurants, etc. We parked our car at the Residence Inn, never had an issue about getting it when we needed it, the rest of our family party, used the $20/day public parking. They opted for the studio room, it was close quarters for 3 adults, but since they only stayed 1 evening and we were out for most of the time, it was ok, but the 1 bedroom, is a much better deal for only a few bucks more. Again, if you want to feel in the thick of things, stay in the Copley Plaza area...but if you want a calmer experience & don't mind a ferry ride, walking or taking cabs, this is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: LMK5
Reviews.Content: I would first say that unless you really need the larger rooms that a Residence Inn offers, you're better off staying in any one of the fine hotels more centrally-located in Boston. One of the issues with this hotel, as I was aware of before my stay, is that it is off to the north in Charlestown. The problem is that if you want to have the pulse of the city at your doorstep, you won't get that here. If you should want to return to the hotel to freshen up after a day of touring, then want to head out into the city at night, you have to retrace your steps once again across the Charlestown Bridge and make your way to what part of the town you want to visit. In a more central location you'd be able to possibly head in a completely different direction right outside your hotel and more efiiciently use your time and energy. Another issue with this hotel is the price. I paid more here than any hotel I've ever stayed in, including a 2-bedroom hotel room in Midtown Manhattan. At this Residence Inn, I had to swallow the steep $369.00/night cost (AAA rate!) for the 2 bedroom suite because it's nearly impossible to find accommodations for larger groups in the heart of the city (I have a family of 5). Even booking this room wasn't easy. In and around Boston, Residence Inn will not allow the 2 bedroom suites to come up on their website unless you book for one week. I realized this by pure chance, and had to "game" the system by first reserving for a week, then shortening my stay to my requirement of 4 nights using the website's reservation system to modify my reservation. Even calling Residence Inn directly wouldn't allow me to book the room for 4 nights. I've never seen this artificial restriction before at this or any other chain. As for the positives, the hotel is located on a neat little wharf where many big yachts are docked. You can walk over to the USS Constitution with ease, and there's this great little restaurant called Max and Dylan's very close by. Of course you also get the free breakfast, an indoor pool, and a location that is quieter than what you would get in the heart of the city. North Station is a 10 minute walk away. In essence, you've got to decide what you really need from your stay. If you want to be in the thick of the great city of Boston, pass this one up. If you need a larger room, a free breakfast, and don't mine reaching deep into the wallet for these benefits, then this property would be a candidate. With benefit of hindsight, another viable option for families would be to stay outside the city in Burlington, Dedham, Waltham, or other areas, pay far less for the room, then simply drive in to the city and pay $25-$35 for parking for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: jwbiv
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is NOT in Boston...it is across a long bridge, or weird pedestrian connection, from Boston. YES it is on the Freedom Trail, at the extreme end of it. Yes, it is on the water, very pretty. However, it is extremely inconvenient to anything else. While there are a couple of dining options nearby (and walking around Charlestown, whcih is where it REALLY is, is charming), the hotel does nothing to direct visitors to them. In fact the staff of the hotel seems to do nothing period. There were kids running through halls, taking over exercise facility, etc. I saw at least four guests complain to front desk, who made no response at all. I have stayed at many Marriott facilities but this was one of the worst. We actually stayed here for "free" (except for $32 a night parking charge) and I still feel like it was a lousy value. Walls are also like paper, could here kids crying all night, and living room of one bedroom "sutie" was so narrow that once our son lowered the sofabed he could not move at all.

Reviews.Title: “I agree.”
Reviews.Author: Seat13F
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice. Location is excellent for tourists being right on several hop-on-hop-off trolley lines. Spacious rooms -- we were upgraded to a suite on a reward stay, perhaps owing to my modest Marriott status. Breakfast was very crowded on both Sun and Mon, try to go early. USe the public parking for $20/day, but be warned it is cash only. Max and Dylans restaurant around the corner is a great place, for kids and adults.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here---IT IS WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: SYLVIATOPEKA
Reviews.Content: Great location, with a wonderful view of the city and a short walk to the Charlestown Naval Yards ("Old Ironsides") and to the North End of Boston and all of the good places there. Don't use the $32 a day valet parking, because there is a lot close to the hotel for $20 a day, also the only unpleasant staff person at the hotel was the valet. The breakfast was better than the usual Residence Inn fare and it varied each day. The room was spacious and up to the Marriott standards. Lisa at the front desk was extremely helpful and gave us tips on where to eat and how to get around. There is a nice pool and hot tub. We would highly recommend this hotel because of its staff and the great location.

Reviews.Title: “good spot”
Reviews.Author: munchyDublin
Reviews.Content: liked the area very much hotel was very friendly rooms are fine a bit basic but id go again, pool was very warm hottub well too hot and i like hot baths, very slippy around pool needs new tiling id say, max and dylans food very nice shame there is no bar in the hotel but il return when going back to boston, breakfast was yummy

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for family”
Reviews.Author: stewiel
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights... Easy to get to anywhere, with quick scenic walk across bridge to North End, and if needed, North Subway Station. Breakfasts are great, rooms are large, staff is friendly and helpful. A real find is Max and Dylan's, just a few steps from the front door...great food and open late. We walked almost everywhere (with our 11 yo grandson and 8.5 yo grand-daughter) including the Children's Museum. This is a fine location for those who want the hassel free breakfast and a 2 or 3 room suite....We will return here next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Your extended business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Chase71
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Residence Inn's across the country. This one is average compared to others. For a short Boston visit its not bad. But long term there's not enough options around it compared to the nearby competition. With just a handful of dining options unless you walk across a bridge to the Boston side it's not the best location for more than a couple of days. The breakfast was good. The night time service was cheese, crackers and nothing hot. At least on a Wednesday evening. But I've stayed at Residence Inn's where every offered meal was a meal. Not cold finger foods. The staff however was excellent and accommodating . In summary don't let the appearance of the wharf location fool you. This is an older Residence Inn. There's other hotels in more advantageous location in Boston that offer better options all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: elawson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the Freedom Trail making it easy to get around. It's on the Charlestown side so its a bit of a hike from downtown Boston. If you have any exercise under your belt and good shoes, the walk should be easy. The North End section of the city is under a mile with tons of restaurants. This hotel is close to a tour bus stop and the water taxis...no car is needed once you get there. that's a good thing because the hotel charges $30 a day for parking and parking in the city is crazy. Our room was a double bedroom with a living room. It was a great deal and the beds were so comfortable. To give you an idea, I found out my father died while I was on this trip...we had to wait until the next day to leave for our flight. I slept much better there than now when I'm home! Our room overlooked the harbor with a boat dock and Boston. During the day, the boats were peaceful and at night, the Boston skyline looked wonderful. Yes, we could even see the Old North Church spire from our window. Breakfast was delicious...eggs, sausage, waffles, croissants, biscuits, etc. And the usual continental spread too. We left stuffed and could put off lunch even after walking all morning. The staff was really on the ball too. We had a kitchen in the room and its convenient...except we had no baking sheet. So it was hard to reheat food (I have 3 little boys). So I called down and they claimed they had no baking sheets in the whole hotel. huh. So someone brought up 1 sheet of aluminum foil. I found it hilarious that they wouldn't trust us with the roll! While on the Freedom Trail, there aren't a huge number of restaurants close. We hit everyone in our three day trip and had to make a bit of a march to find anything new. There is an AWESOME ice cream place (Emack and Bolio's) less than a block away. For those of you with kids, there's a cute playground less than a block away. Just walk behind the hotel and there it is. Clean, convenient with picnic tables too. I wished they had told me about it when I checked it. I saw it as we passed over the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Boston”
Reviews.Author: sundance211
Reviews.Content: My family and I were looking for a reasonably priced weekend getaway, and were surprised to find this Residence Inn at an affordable rate in Boston. The suites were a good size for 2 adults and 2 small children. The bedroom and living room in the 1 bedroom suites were fully separated, providing privacy for the late evening hours after the kids go to sleep. The location of the hotel was great. While not right in the middle of the major Boston attractions, this hotel still sits right on the Harbor, and we had no trouble walking to all of our desired destinations. The staff was incredibly friendly, more so than any other hotel we've stayed at in recent memory. The only complaint we had was one that probably would not bother most people, but is worth mentioning. Our room was on the second floor, overlooking the harbor - a pretty nice view. During the day we could watch the activity of the neighboring marina, the boats sailing on the harbor, and the planes taking off and landing at Logan Airport in the distance. But shortly after sunset, the hotel would turn on some VERY bright floodlights that were pointed right up at our windows to illuminate the building. Unfortunately, it completely wiped out all view from the window, so relaxing with a drink while overlooking the harbor in the late evenings and nights was out of the question. Overall our stay was excellent, and we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with kids”
Reviews.Author: bebecailin
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Boston with 2 young children and found this hotel totally met all our requirements. We had a lovely suite, with separate bedroom with TV (2 queen beds) & travel cot was provided. It had a separate lounge room with TV, small kitchenette, which included a fridge freezer and dishwasher, microwave and hob. The separate living room was great Breakfast was included in the rate which was great. Cereals, waffles, muffins, bagels, toast, fruit/yoghurts, and hot food, scrambled eggs, sausages etc and we loved it. On 4 of the evenings they also provided an evening snack/reception downstairs, different theme each night i.e. pizza night, BBQ etc. The location was great also for us. We love walking and it was about 15min walk to Faniel Hall/Aquarium. and 10 mins to Italian district. The hotel is about 5 mins from US constitution. If you walk through the shipyard, you can get the boat taxi to the Aquarium which is right beside Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market.(about $1.90 pp and kids are free). As mentioned on the site, if you turn left coming out of the hotel and walk through the little park (which has a lovely quiet playground for the kids) and over the water bridges, you reach North Station (Under big sign for D Garden). You can get subway pretty much anywhere from here. We found all the subway stations fully accessible as we were travelling with double stroller, just look for the wheelchair sign for lifts. Kids free on the subway. We would walk over the Charles River Bridge and that would take you straight down to the North End, lots of great Italians. Beside the hotel is a lovely restaurant which is great for kids, Max & Dylanâ€™s. There is also a great ice cream shop and Sorrels coffee shop. We had fantastic time in Boston. Went to Childrens Museum (highlight for the kids), Aquarium, Big Apple Circus, Boston Common with frog playground, Swan Boats, Harvard/Cambridge., Franklin Pk Zoo. Some good restaurants we ate in which were good with kids, Max & Dylans (beside hotel -good kids menu), Antico Forno, Salem St, Joes - beside Aquarium at Christopher Columbus Pk (playground outside it and good kids menu ), Cheesecake Factory at prudential Centre.
