We also took a trip to outlets in Wrentham, private coach picked us up at hotel, kids were free - got some great bargains there. Overall , had a very enjoyable trip and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “yes”
Reviews.Author: halitozis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with mobile but elderly mom - with her in br and me on pullout. Good location - a 15 min walk to subway and tucked next to glorious old neighborhood of Charlestown. Nice breakfest. Free internet in room. Last year we were at the Back Bay Hilton. This year here and ... we prefer this location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations, but not clean.”
Reviews.Author: dysalexic
Reviews.Content: The room was everything that we could have hoped for. We got a suite, last minute, for very cheap. The front desk was more than accommodating for all our needs. The only thing I will complain about is the cleanliness of the rooms. As a housekeeper for a high end inn, maybe I'm a little picky, but I spotted lots of hairs in the tub and bathroom as well as blood or some stains on the walls. I feel like the housekeeping staff could take a little more time to make this hotel a great value. Also the linens were poor and when I called down to get a couple of extra comforters (I mean, it's cold in April in New England!!) they said they had no more and brought up a very thin and worn fleece blanket as a substitute.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: shfkjdhfdsj
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was extremely comfortable and clean. I slept so well. We had a room that overlooked the harbor and we could see the Old North Church. It was just blocks away from the Italian neighborhood and Faneuil Hall. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Comish32
Reviews.Content: My wife, son (almost 3), and I stayed for Easter weekend. (2 nights) First off, I couldn't be more pleased with the staff. From parking attendant to housekeeping EVERYBODY was accommodating and friendly! This is a great fit hotel if you are staying with family. Very clean, plenty of room, and the ability to use the kitchen with microwave and refridgerator helps solve several small issues that might come up when trying to feed kids....and adults for that matter. The Freedom Trail is right across the street and takes you to the Bunker Hill Monument, and the Harbor where the USS Constitution is. (Pretty cool for a guy who teaches Am. History) The hotel is in the Charlestown area so if you want to stay in the heart of downtown Boston this isn't the best choice BUT it is a short walk over a bridge into the "Little Italy" North End. Parking is expensive, but I guess that comes with the teritory in a city like this. Pool is small, but nice. The complimentary breakfast was great! The view from our room on the 8th floor....AWESOME! I would stay here again if we come back as a family :)

Reviews.Title: “Could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: TX_TnE
Reviews.Content: Nice view of the river and marina, and an easy walk to the Garden for shows/events. The room was not very clean. There were multiple smudges and specks on the walls, doors, sink/faucet, etc. and the furniture was worn. The linens were of a very poor quality, with thin, scratchy towels in the bath area and old, droopy pillows on the bed. The breakfast was nice and the eating area is very cozy - fireplace and views of the marina.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: dannycl
Reviews.Content: So we stayed 3 nights. we took Amtrak into Boston from Albany and got a cab from South Station, $13.00 with tip. the room was great with 2 rooms , 2 TVs afull kitchen. the pool satisified the 12 and 13 year old and the breakfast (free included was great). Internet is included free. ohers have complained about the location but we found many restaurants and sights to see. You could see the masts of the Constitution from our room. we overlooked a marina. The water shuttle was $1.70 each and let us off right at the Aquarium, this shuttle was a 8 minute walk from our room. Taxis are always available and we found a place to eat within walking ditance on Saturday night at 9:45 PM. The staff were amazingly friendly and helpful and there is even free food weeknights. The location is not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: pokerolls
Reviews.Content: I'm at the hotel now and the staff is the best I've ever came across even Disney great location you can walk acroos the bridge or get in a cab to go were you want to go I will be back soon as the Celtics play the Lakers again the arena is only a 10 minute walk ALL I CAN SAY IS THIS IS GREATWITH A HARBORVIEW ROOM.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good value”
Reviews.Author: L0vie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Marriott in Charlestown. Room was clean, well appointed and very quiet. The bed was a little too soft for my liking but not uncomfortable. Valet parking is $32, so park yourself at Constitution Wharf (no in and out privlege there) for $20. Easy walk to the North End and great view of the harbor. Breakfast was good, but crowded at 9:00am on Sunday morning. Front desk staff was okay, not particularly friendly but got the job done. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, great stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: alacraft
Reviews.Content: We bought a weekly pass for $15 on the "t" and took the "t" from logan airport to the North Station. It was a quick walk from there to the Residence Inn. A bit hard to locate at first, I found it to be an ideal location as the week went on. Room 719 had a nice view of the water and I was happy to see the windows opened a bit to let fresh air in. Breakfasts were complete, and convenient. We paid $229/night which was fair. The gym was a bit small, I tried to jog outside but got a bit lost. The treadmills had small tv's to watch but there were only 2, and 2 stationary bikes and one eliptical trainer in this small gym. One treadmill seemed broken. Rooms were clean, and spacious. Even tho just my husband and I were in the rooms it was nice to be able to close the bedroom door and sleep while he watched late night tv. Housekeeping did a nice job of cleaning every day. It was a short walk to the north end, lots of great Italian restaurants, Mikes pastry, and the "t" station was right next to the Gardens where hockey and basketball are played. We got last minute Red Sox tickets on stubhub and took the "t" to the game. Easy to get around by walking or on the "t". Bunker Hill monument within walking distance, and a red marking, just outside the hotel makes it easy to follow the Freedom Trail. Our flight didnt depart until 4pm so we got a late checkout at 1 and stashed our luggage at the front desk without problems until it was time to take the "t" to the airport. I would stay here again if I returned to Boston. There was a small pool and spa, but I'm not crazy about getting into a tub of warm chlorine so I didnt use them.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, pleasant hotel, with a friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: whitegown9
Reviews.Content: While this hotel didn't have many buzzes and whistles, it was clean, the rooms were nice, and the staff was very friendly. I did have room service while I was there as well, and while the selection was limited, the food was delicious and delivered incredibly quickly. I really have no complaints about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: DRD
Reviews.Content: Great place- fantastic views, nice pool, a short stroll to Bunker Hill, 15 minute drive into Cambridge, just across the bridge from the Italian district. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Too much money for the location”
Reviews.Author: Corn&Beans
Reviews.Content: Upfront: this is not your average Res Inn. This is the upper upscale end of the chain, and if you show up with all your little kids and lots of luggage, the staff looks down their noses, even if you have rented *3* suites and are paying $32 a night for parking. The valet parking was not able to handle all the cars at once, and to keep from getting a ticket for blocking the road we had to use the parking next door, which cost an extra $17 though we were in there only 20 minutes. Better than a ticket from the meter maid. Sunday am we called for our car, waited in the room until we saw it out front, then came down- and they had reparked it. Hmph. The one person who was helpful - or tried to be- Friday night sent us (party of 10) to one high end restaurant which was closed for a private party (Kennedy wake?). Then he sent us to another far lower scale one, which turned out to be only a bar over the water, with high open stairs to climb for a gramps with replaced hips and little kids. And only to find out food was not served after 8 pm. Someone doesn't have much of a list he is working off of. So we went to the Marriott's Sports Bar (in Cambridge), which we knew of through the school. Used reviews for other meals. Speaking of the location, this hotel is impossible to find, even with the hotel on the phone to guide you. Lots of one way streets that are unmarked, dark, etc. Lost every day but the last, when we were leaving. One bright spot is that there is a dog park just under the bridge, and a little kids play ground beside that. Lots of gang tags though. Breakfast was more than standard - with the addition of taco shells, salsas, and soda fountain drinks for breakfast. Very nice area, and the nicest people working that in the whole hotel. They bus for you. The rooms were comfortable, but small like usual city hotels. This one's rooms were the same size as the Homewood Suites N Airport San Francisco. With the sofa bed extended, there were inches to the TV stand. The windows open, and we had terrific breezes off the bay overlooking the Constitution Marina next door. The actual Constitution ship is a half mile down, and you can only see the top of the masts even from the 7th floor. However, you can hear the cannon shot at 8am and 7:30 pm daily. Fireworks went off Sunday night/Mon am at 12:30 am, after the ball game I guess, probably from the neighboring park area, but scared the heck out of us. With the windows open, it sounded like artillery fire, and you could smell the acrid smoke on the wind. Since we had been asleep, fireworks for the ball game were the last thing we thought of- would have been nice to have a warning, since this is the age of terrorism.

Reviews.Title: “Two room suite was great for a two day stay”
Reviews.Author: gchrist256
Reviews.Content: Large bedrooms and a comfortable living and dining area made this a great location for a short stay in Boston. Location was at Tudor Wharf close to downtown and the North End right on the Freedom Trail. It was an easy walk (over the bridge to Boston) to a variety of places, plus cabs were also present if you want to go that route. Breakfast was good and had a wide array of items. Views from the two room suite were of North Church from one bedroom and the Bunker Hill Monument from the other. The living area overlooked the harbor. Great choice for a visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of space, location is not bad”
Reviews.Author: cshepNashville_TN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for a weekend get a way in Boston. The room was very nice... comfy, clean and spacious. We walked from the hotel to the North End and it wasn't a bad walk at all. I have to admit that I was a little disappointed with the overall service of the hotel. I've had better service at a Holiday Inn. I would probably not stay here again. The view of the harbor was not worth the extra price of the room. For the money we spent, I just expected a little bit more from the staff. They were not the kind that you felt would go above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job for a family on a budget”
Reviews.Author: SDPadres
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed here the weekend of July 10-13, 2009. ($175.) The hotel was sold out F/S. The tall ships were in town and many hotels were packed. Boston hotel rooms are on the more expensive side. Our room was a one bedroom suite. It had a K bed in the bedroom where the bathroom and closet were also located. The paint and counters were clean and fairly new. No issues at all. The tub/shower handle would come off everytime we turned it and was never fixed or attended to while we were there. The furniture and cabinets in our room (700) were very worn and beat up looking. We had 3 windows in our unit. So we had lovely views of Charlestown and the water. The "living room" area was small, when the sofa bed folded out you could not walk from one end to the other. The sofa bed itself was missing 4 of 7 springs making it impossible to sleep on. We requested another room or even a rollaway but were told no rooms were available and there weren't any rollaways Friday or Sat, night. Nor Sunday night even though they weren't sold out at this point. We threw the mattress on the floor and pretended to camp. It's ok for a child and we survived, though when checking out and mentioned it again.... the desk acted as it that was the first they had heard of it....No real resolution. The breakfast was top notch for being included in the room price. Short of made to order eggs that would take long there was a great variety. Fresh fruit, oatmeal with toppings, make your own waffles, bagels, scrambled eggs, yogurt, donuts, cereal, tortillas for breakfast burritos, coffee, juices, and even the "sodas" were available for those who like their caffeine cold. The staff was extremely cordial and would bus your plates before you had time to put your napkin down. We would eat a very hearty breakfast and then go for an early dinner, to avoid crowds and we just weren't that hungry a few hours after the big breakfast. Wi fi was free and there is an area for you to print out your boarding passes etc for no charge, which was pleasant. We were able to check emails and google museum times etc with our laptop in our room.. We enjoyed the jacuzzi and there were always fresh pool towels available. The elevator and doors on the front side of the hotel are key access. As for parking, it's pay. Or find a spot behind the hotel or down in the park area. (not a lot of them but you could get lucky) The rates did change over the weekend. $38 on Saturday and $32 on Sunday. So if you are going to park make sure you get the cheapest rate for all your days. The location is a question. In bad weather it would not be my first choice. In nice weather it was fine. It was a 7-9 minute walk for us through the canal/locks and Paul Revere park to the North Station where we could catch the metro or T. It's a 10 minute walk or so to the North End which is a great place. The Constitution is about 5 minutes away and a great place to go. There is a bus if you are comfortable with the bus system. The 93 is right across the street and is with a covered station kiosk and will take you pretty much downtown. And the 92 is just a tad farther and it also goes downtown. We ended up just walking as the weather was spectacular and we enjoyed watching the boats go through the locks as we walked to the N. Station. (Green and Orange lines and commuter rail is here). I don't know if I would stay here again. I may opt for the Residence Inn in Cambridge (right on the T) and save the difference or may try a different place if I was coming in the winter for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with stay”
Reviews.Author: soonermom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights over the weekend. It was a little crazy in the area because of the Tall Ships presence in Boston. I had to park nearby in the Constitution Center's lot, which worried me a little. (I was afraid my car would be towed.) It was safe there, however, for all three nights and ended up being 12 dollars a day cheaper than hotel parking! When we checked in the desk clerk was very helpful and gave lots of suggestions as to where I should take my nine year old daughter and where we should eat. Although the location is a little removed from downtown, it is wonderful for exploring the Constitution, the Naval Yard, and Bunker HIll. It was a short walk over the Charlestown Bridge to the North End, where we loved Regina's Pizza (one of the clerk's suggestions.) The restaurant was well worth the forty-five minute wait. It was also just off the Freedom Trail, which was my history-buff daughter's primary destination. I was pleased with the hotel breakfast selections, the cleanliness of my room, and everything. The price I paid was extremely reasonable for Boston. The only reason I might not stay there again would be I prefer to be a little closer to the Boston Common, Beacon Hill area. However, the walk to those locations, which we made frequently, was not too taxing.

Reviews.Title: “Comforatable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kaspski
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk from downtown Boston, and is in decent proximity to North Station and the New England Aquarium. The hotel room was quite comfortable, and the in-room kitchenette makes it ideal for longer stays. It was our first visit to Boston, so we weren't entirely sure where to stay. A downtown location might have been a little more convenient for shopping, visiting Boston Common, etc. but it is still very walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, good location, just had the feeling of a convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: corevel
Reviews.Content: Just as the title reads. It was ok, the staff was nice and courteous, close to mass transit and alot of attractions. About 15-20 minute and $25-30 cab ride from the airport. Oh yeah, 12.95 per day for internet is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: na07950
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn last week for two evenings and enjoyed the stay. The room was clean and had everything that was promised (although our view was of the bridge and parking lot)! The location was convenient for us, but is a bit of a walk to the regular tourist sites. Great breakfast and the staff at the breakfast service was wonderful (very attentive and everything was fully stocked and the area clean). The fitness center is small but has all the basics. Our only suggestion for improvement was the valet service. It was a bit unorganized and at one point, we just had to take our keys off the top of the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dnabears
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently with our dog. I was afraid the room might smell like dog or be full of hair but it was EXTREMELY clean. The room was very spacious and had a great view of the harbor.The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. If you don't mind walking a little it's close by the strip of bars / restaraunts / shops. We only took a cab once and walked the rest of the time. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: plbunker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling with our 9 year old and we like to have room to spread out and have separate sleeping areas. We stayed in a 1 bedroom unit and it was very comfortable. It was well stocked and had a great view of the wharf. We found the location, just across the bridge from North End and right on the Freedom Trail, ideal for sightseeing. My husband and son loved the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: psujack2007
Reviews.Content: This place is ideally located. It is right next to The North End, which has an unbelievable variety of Italian restaurants and bakeries. The TD Bank Garden is within 5 minutes as is Faneuil Hall. The views of the city and the harbor are georgeous. The hotel is very nice with large rooms, attentive staff, and plenty of amenities. This hotel is great for families, businessmen, and travelers looking for a romantic getaway. To top it off, the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly and helpful service”
Reviews.Author: yankeesfan7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to be close to TD Banknorth Gardens for a Celtics game. In the middle of Friday afternoon rush hour in Boston, we discovered that we had misplaced the directions to the hotel so we called the desk on our cell. We were given very detailed directions and the overall attitude of the receptionist was most kind. Upon arrival, check-in was prompt and our rooms were clean and comfortable with a beautiful harbor view. It was only a 10-minute walk to the game. The breakfast was very fine - buffet style with waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, home fries, cereal, etc. and even on a Saturday morning, there was plenty of food and attentive staff. The desk again gave us good advice on sightseeing and allowed us to leave our car until 2:30PM while were touring. We give high marks to the hotel and to the desk help and would certainly highly recommend it to anyone. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, comfortable hotel, fabulous deal”
Reviews.Author: Manuela3
Reviews.Content: What a find for the Boston area! We booked this room online for $109.00 and got a big clean suite, with a kitchenette stocked with coffee and tea and the fixings. The room was clean, spacious and quiet with a great view of the bridge that my husband says they show in the beginning of Boston Legal (for all you fans)! The bed was comfy. The location is within walking distance of some good restaurants. We tried to snag a free parking spot by the bridge, but they were taken so we parked right next to the hotel and paid the $20 fee, which considering what we paid for the hotel, was fine. Breakfast was very good...hot and cold options like hot oatmeal, waffles, eggs, sausage, cereal...something for everyone. This is a great alternative to the high prices that we've paid in Boston before and truly a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but wouldn't pay that extra for the view next time around...”
Reviews.Author: Karascorner
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I of 6 1/2 years usually stay outside Boston in Waltham or Newton since it's almost always cheaper and easy to get in and out of Boston but for a change we stayed here Jan 10-13th because the AAA rate was actually pretty low for being "in the city". This is technically Charlestown but it's so close to big Boston attractions you would hardly even be able to tell the difference. We paid for overnight parking at the Riverside T station since it was much cheaper than the hotel rate, took the T to North Station and then did the .7 mile walk to the hotel from there. POSITIVES: For being practically in the city, you get a lot for your space. Here the rooms are "suites". They come with a living room, and a reasonably furnished mini-kitchen with a full-size fridge, microwave, stove, plates, cups, bowls, and utensils. The table in the kitchenette had a complimentary basket filled with coffee, tea, and even a bag of microwaveable popcorn. The bathroom was clean. We really took advantage of the adjustable heater near the floor in it, it worked out great for letting us dry our wet shoes from the winter snow. My favorite part of the shower was that the shower head was adjustable so that you could change it from a regular spray to a pulsating one if you'd like and it really took little to no time at all for the water to heat up. For being right next to a major bridge, it wasn't noisy at all during the night. The complimentary breakfast was nice. It was buffet style and offered alot of variety: cold cereal, oatmeal, pancakes, french toast, scrambled eggs, sausage, breakfast potatoes, juice, coffee, tea, hot cocoa, mixed fruit, bananas, oranges, yogurt, english muffins, bagels, muffins, and they even had a belgian waffle machine out with cups of regular or fruit mix so you could make your own. Even after breakfast was done, we noticed that the coffee machines are left out and we were easily able to grab a complimentary coffee/tea to go. Staff was very friendly, and helpful. Our room was missing the "No Service" sign and once bringing this up to the front desk, the issue was resolved in a matter of minutes. The distance to the TD Banknorth Garden, USS Constitution and Bunker Hill Monument are unbeatable. Both are easily within a 5 minute walk from the hotel, and less than 1/3 mile. A Store24 convenience store is literally, a 3 minute walk away (it's on the corner of 1st Ave and 6th St) . It's just inside the Navy Base for the USS Constitution. We felt like we were trespassing on federal property when we were trying to find it just before midnight. It has a lot of stuff in there for reasonable prices--even though it's a convenience store. We wish we knew this before checking out the hotel's mini-market and were thrilled to find Hot Pockets and Friendly's sundae's to go. In comparison, this is by far a much better deal for the money if you get the need for a midnight snack. Bear in mind though, since it is on a Navy Base, it is not open 24hrs. It was only open 6am-midnight. NEGATIVES: We paid the extra for the room with the "Harbor view" and ended up in Suite #524. My boyfriend and I agreed that we would not pay the extra for the view again, as it was not what we expected-- it was more like a bridge view looking at the TD Banknorth Garden than anything else (see my photos). We actually left the room in the cold of the winter night and went along the pathway to the docks outside the hotel to enjoy the view better and take pictures from there. The decorative rounded pillow on the bed had a gross stain on it--but hey, who really uses those to sleep on anyway?? I didn't really think this was a big deal, but nevertheless I'm noting it. The bathroom sink, wasn't inside the bathroom. This was annoying when one of us would get up in the night to use the bathroom and then wash our hands because the sound of the sink would wake the other one up. The whirlpool in the pool area needs some more jets, none of them really seem to hit in the right areas, and the seating bench in it should be lower. It needed at least 2 inches more of water because the top row of bubbler jets weren't covered and just spraying air at us. The temperature should have been warmer too. It wasn't terrible by any means, but could use some improvement. The vending machines, are not vending machines at all. It's the hotels mini-market. My boyfriend was starved and looking for a midnight snack so we checked it out. $1 for a candy bar and $4 for a B&J Half-Baked icecream bar---the worst part? The icecream bar not only smelt like cardboard, but it kinda tasted like it too. We couldn't find a date on it and we're really curious as to how long it had been sitting in there for. If you're in the mood for a midnight snack, definitely put some clothes on and take the 3 minute stroll to the Store24 right inside the Navy base-it's worth the walk. OVERALL TIPS: Especially to those who are considering staying here and don't mind the walk: 1) If you're getting here via North Station and then walking to the hotel, make sure you cross N Washington Street PRIOR to crossing over the Charlestown bridge because you want to be on the right side of it as you go over it. It's next to impossible to cross at the intersection once you're over the bridge. The intersection once you are over the bridge is not pedestrian friendly at all. 2) As you're walking to the hotel, once you turn onto Chelsea street/City Square, you'll see this big archway on your right, go through it and take the stairs down on the left side and at the bottom of the stairs on your right is the Inn. This will save you the extra walking from going to Warren St, to Water St, to Constitution Rd to get to the hotel. 3) As I've mentioned before... for late night snacking, definitely go to the Store24 and not the hotel mini-market.

Reviews.Title: “Good Christmas Holiday at the Residence”
Reviews.Author: Landwlkr
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I chose to stay at this hotel because of it's location to Charlestown (where we have family) and because we could each have our own bedroom. The hotel isn't very old, just a few years. Here are the good points and bad: GOOD: The hotel staff were all incredibly friendly. I was greeted warmly on arrival and all my special requests had been met. Our room was clean, comfortable and quite spacious. We had a full kitchen with oven, fridge, microwave. Some limited utensils, a pot, pan and coffeemaker. We brought food and extra gadgets we might need. Both rooms have their own full bath. NEEDS IMPROVEMENT: the beds weren't the most comfortable I have ever slept in, that's for sure. The TVs could use a little update. It would be nice if the clock radio's also had Ipod adapters, but that might be asking a bit much. The gym area is OK, 2 or 3 treadmills, an elyptical, and a stationary bike facing out towards the harbor (but bring sunglasses in the morning so you don't get blinded). Breakfast was what you would expect... some scrambled eggs, pancakes, french toast, bagels, coffee, juice, yogurt, fruit and cereal. Buffet style. All in all, it was a good vacation, Mom and I were glad for the extra space and the nice view of Boston harbor. The location isn't ideal for most, but we wanted to be in Charlestown. Side tip: there are free parking spaces next to the hotel by the bridge. They don't advertise them, and there are only about 20 or so-- so the lot does fill out. But it's worth it to save the very expensive valet!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RAYANDRON
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice in the last couple of months, because of the location the price is less then downtown Boston, but don't let that fool you, the hotel is still with in walking distances to alot of the attractions, and public transportation ( you really do not want to drive in Boston unless you have to. the cab fare to Faniual Hall with tip is less them 10.00., You can also take the water shuttle for a few dollars that brings you to Aquarium area and get a great Boston skyline and Harbor sight seeing trip. Back to the hotel, we stayed in both the one bedroom suite and two bedroom suite. I would not recomment the one bedroom suit if there are more than 2 people, the rooms were very clean and roomy. the kitchen was a nice feature. The restaruant on sight food was ok. We ordered room service one night and food was served in to go containers and was charged a room service charge and delivery charge, I found out later I could call in the order and go down and pick it up my self, which I would have done if all I was getting is take out. they also have a hot buffet breakfast everymorning. the food is good, and there is a good variety.

Reviews.Title: “You will absolutely enjoy the hospitality at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Honestly-M
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I recently traveled to Boston in order to visit several colleges. This Marriott property was offering a special rate for this hotel,and so that is how we landed at this particular property. I was not disappointed. The room was lovely as well as spacious. I do not understand the comment by others about a poor location There is about a two block walk to the T, which takes you anywhere you want to go in Boston, Cambridge, and surrounding area...even out to Boston College. You can take a walk over the bridge to the North End and see the Old North Church , Paul Reveres house, or to check out a good Italian restaurant or bakery.There is a view of the Harbor on one side of the buiding and the TD Bank-Garden and Zakim Bridge(see photo) on the other. More importantly, the staff at this hotel is excellent. The front desk instructed me about how to get around on the T, recomended great restaurants, and provided us with maps. The breakfast buffet was delicious, providing something for everyone, including the health consciuos. So, unless you are looking for a high end Luxury hotel, I think this is a safe bet. Don't miss taking a look at Harvard Square for shopping and Harvard Yard for a look at our nations history.

Reviews.Title: “Nice headquarters for a family trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: bamom91
Reviews.Content: I loved the waterfront views from the Residence Inn. Rooms were extremely clean and very spacious, which made it perfect for a stay with the kids. Everyone had enough room to move around. The hotel was quiet and comfortable and the perfect place to relax after a day of seeing the sights in Boston. I didn't use the kitchen but it looked well equipped enough for one to cook a simple meal. The morning breakfast offerings were good, but because we stayed there on a summer weekend, the dining area was packed with families and kids and it was a little hard to get a table. There aren't many restaurants nearby so be prepared to walk or take a cab to dinner. Otherwise, this was a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Generic90
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property during my tenure on a consulting project, which lasted from July 2007 through August 2008. This is a newer property near the Charlestown Navy Yard, along Boston Harbor and the entrance to the Charles River, but right up against the old Charlestown Bridge. This means that half the suites face the bridge and have virtually no view, while the other half has a very pleasant view. Fortunately, I had an upper-floor room with the harbor view during my stay. The facility and suites were very safe and secure, and the property is in a safe part of the city. If you drive, free parking is exceedingly limited, so in all likelihood, you will find yourself utilizing the valet service. For those who choose to walk and/or utilize transit, the facility is within easy walking distance to Bunker Hill and is practically within a few minute-walk from the USS Constitution. It is a 10-minute walk across the river to the TD Banknorth Garden - which also houses the closest transit station - and the historic North End neighborhood. Taxis are frequently queued outside the property, so for those not inclined to walk, access to the rest of the city is easy. The weak points are that - while there are some good full-service restaurants in the neighborhood - quick-service restaurants were non-existent. There was a servicable - albeit unspectacular - grocery store that was also about a 10-minute walk from the hotel. Overall cleanliness of the property was very good to excellent. The suite was somewhat small, but as a solo traveler, it was spacious enough, and was comfortable. The suite was clean, and all was in good working order. If something did happen to break or otherwise go wrong, maintenance services were responsive and made things right in short order. The bed was very comfortable. The kitchenette was fine, although a bit impractical to do anything more than microwave cooking. The suites were quiet, so external disturbances were minimal. From time to time, hot water in the suite could be hard to come by. But usually that was in the morning during the time that they were making their breakfast and when those guests heading to work were likely to be up and getting ready for the day. Laundry services were plentiful, albeit a bit expensive. There was a free breakfast service served seven days a week, which offered a good variety of food and was generally satisfying. On Mondays through Thursdays from 5pm to 6:30pm, they served a free hospitality snack and/or beverage, which often times was hearty enough to be an evening meal. The facility did have a cafe, which in the warmer months had the bulk of its seating outside on the pier, that was decent. In the summer months, the hotel also offered free movies that were shown on the pier. The front desk staff was overall very pleasant and responsive to all guest requests. They were also very knowledgable about the area, and the best options to access them. The housekeeping was also very pleasant, and even the property managers were pretty cordial and responsive. Overall, I had a very good lodging experience at this property. I did have colleagues who worked with me at various times during my tenure there who had different experiences with suite quality and such, but I cannot speak to those individual opinions. All I can say is that I would recommend this property with no qualms - particularly if you can procure a room with the harbor view.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: sandaUk
Reviews.Content: Clean and roomy accomodation, helpful staff, good service. Small pool. Location in Charlstown v nice area - wish we'd explored more and near to Bunker Hill and USS Constitution, quiet - but not many shops close and a fair walk into Boston itself. Not on Metro route. Research location carefully and ensure you're ok with that!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: You know, it is so nice to go to a city and find a hotel that treats you like they are in a small town. I was very impressed with the Residence Inn Tudor Wharf. From the Front Desk manager to the valet they were friendly and courteous. But not the fake courteous. I would highly recommend this hotel! One thing, being they are in a historical area and Boston has seen numerous changes to the road system, don't trust your tom tom even if it has been updated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great view but not the best location for tourists!”
Reviews.Author: lip89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during my wedding in December and booked all the guests here as well since it was close proximity to the Navy Yard where I was getting married. I was very impressed at how new the hotel is and how friendly the staff is. The place was built in the last few years and is tucked away close to the Charlestown Navy Yard. It is quite nice coming into the lobby and it has a continental breakfast area that I was atucally quite impressed with. There is a fireplace that makes the place cozy. The rooms are quite nice as well. We stayed in a junior suite and there was a small kitchen in there in a seperate area and a couch. The views from the rooms are awesome, with a great view of the city and the large Zackum Bridge. You are right on the harbor so it is great to see the scenery. I would say for tourists this isnt the best location. You are across the river in Charlestown which is a $10 cab ride into the city. If you are going to pay this kind of money to saty here, stay within the city limits. This place is more for people that want to stay outside the city and stil be close. I would recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: ellie01
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel overall was good but the location was poor. The room had refrigerator, stove and a sink. In the morning a full breakfast was served buffet style, which was a plus. There was a pool that was very nice, my kids enjoyed it very much. The only downside to this hotel is the location to the center of the city. If you want to get to the main attractions you must walk over the Charlestown Bridge, which I found dangerous. The pedestrian walkway was very narrow and walking with a carriage made it even worse because there was a steep climb. There is a trolley which stops a few feet from the hotel but it was a long wait getting to the hotel because of all the traffic (I waited 1 1/2 hours and the trolley never came). One helpful tip if you are staying in this hotel would be not to use valet service. It was expensive and for half the price you could park it yourself right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront - Marina - Great Views - NICE Rooms - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: 22601go
Reviews.Content: Weekend getaway in Boston.. Took the water taxi from Logan airport to dock in front of hotel..nice walk to Bunker Hill..short ride to Hanover St. to great food in little Italy.. check out the Daily Catch.. or Olives a three min. walk from the hotel .. great value.. great service..enjoy this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: dcer1432
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was a little over my normal budget, I was more than pleased with the facility and location. The hotel itself was immaculate. The rooms were huge and very comfortable. We were only fortunate enough to have the continental breakfast they offered and it was by far one of the best I have ever seen or had. It had just about everything you could imagine and then some. The location of the Marriott was perfect for those attending a show or sporting event at the TD Bank North Garden (Old Fleet Center), a stroll to Quincy Market, or sightseeing along the Boston Harbor and the USS Constitution. it took us only about 5-10 minutes to walk through a quaint, safe and beautiful park, across the canal to get to the Garden. Quincy Market was maybe about a 15 minute walk, and the USS Constitution was only about 2 minutes away. Another good thing about the hotel was that pets were also allowed. there is a charge for them, but after all pets are a part of some families.... This is the 4th hotel I have stayed at in the greater Boston area and one of which I will soon come back to!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: wow47
Reviews.Content: A great hotel! My husband and I traveled to Boston for some fun and we found it. This hotels location was perfect for us. We flew in to Logan and jumped on the T to get to hotel. It was very easy and cheap. We loved the hotels Charlestown location. The neighborhoods were beautiful ane we loved the Warren Tavern. The hotels location made it easy to walk to the North End, Thaniel Hall, even Newberry Street. I will say we are big walkers but it was all managable. The hotel was very clean with great views. We were very pleased over-all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: murphykelk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 9-27-29th for a concert. Honestly, I wasn't thrilled with staying here but the hotel was paid for so I wasn't expecting too much. I read reviews about the parking behind the hotel but did it anyway. Our car had an alarm which was a rented vehicle and I took the chance. I noticed the day we left there had been some window glass in the spot next to me so it appeared as though someone's window had been broken into. The location was great. This I cannot stress enough. Get a high floor room if you can. We aksed for a waterview but they were booked up. The room was clean and was big enough for us. I would think anymore than two people would be too cramped. The front desk was more than helpful and accomodating. They even printed out my boarding passes for me since I forgot. Bunker hill was a short walk from the Inn and beautiful. Breeder's Hill, the climb of 294 steps was worth it and the walk around the neighborhoods was great. We walked to the north end right over the bridge and ate Pizza Reggina(cash only) and a great atmosphere. We got to the Inn on Thursday, Friday went to concert in the evening and we really hustled to see everything. We accomplished quite a bit and my legs feel it for sure. When we have more time we will go back to Boston. It has a wonderful feel to the city with so much history and beauty. Cons: Granted it's not a hotel they could have had a better selection of late night room service. Room service ends at 9:30 p.m. The parking is a risk. Pro's: Great location. Good service. free breakfast with plenty to chose from. I would stay here again since the location was great and the people were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: NC123Nj
Reviews.Content: The Marriot had a great location if you don't have a car. It's a 10 minute walk to the T, right outside the North End (Little Italy). I stayed with 5 other women for a long girls weekend. We were accommadated with an early check in, the front desk was extremely helpful. They offered help even when we didn't ask. They called Duck Tours and booked tickets for us at the last minute and had the tickets faxed to us. We had requested adjoining rooms, but no rooms there are attached. We just had rooms next to each other. The rooms were clean, bright and cheerful and pretty comfortable. The couch was a little "industrial", but no big deal. The shower was wonderful, nice and big and a great showerhead. Beds were very nice also. The only thing wrong about the rooms were that we were on the 2nd floor and our view was the side of the bridge-the one with the Freedom Trail across it. Other than that -the rooms were great. The breakfast you get with the room was better than some you pay for in restaurants. The selection of food was tremendous, always hot and always plenty of it. Coffee was good too. You could make a plate and bring it to your room if there wasn't enough seating. The lobby basically held the buffet which seemed a little odd-but as I said-if you couldn't get a table or you felt funny eating out in the open-go back to your room. The cafe was open for lunch and dinner-same set-up-in the lobby. Food is simple-sandwiches, salads, nothing special. With all the great choices just outside your door-go to the breakfast but forget about anything else. They do have a tiny "store" in the lobby for candy, beverages, frozen food and ice cream. A nice touch if you really need it. Dollar for dollar the suite was well worth the price and the breakfast included made it even better. We never made it to the complimentary dinner-not sure what that was all about, but I heard the front desk staff telling people about it. The pier was nice and when the weather was warmer and all the tables were outside I'm sure it was very pretty. The airport is only 3 miles away, a great plus. The staff made sure we got a taxi van that fit 5 people instead of two taxis that would cost much more. I can't say enough about them-the front desk staff-my brother broke his glasses and they found some crazy glue for him. I would defintely stay at this hotel again and I highly recommend it when you go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LJ233
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at this hotel Sept 13-17 in a waterfront suite. We were on the 7th floor at the very end of the floor. The harbor view was fantastic! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The morning breakfast was quite good and fresh. The walls are thin and we could hear conversations and the T.V. but they stopped at a reasonable hour. Location was good. Walking distance to the North End where there is an abundance of excellent restaurants and pastry shops. We took the water taxi and the T to get around to other parts of the city. We have no complaints and would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly decent tourist hotel, with REALLY comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: viross5000
Reviews.Content: This is a clean pleasant hotel in a great location for tourists. A quick hop across the bridge and you're at north station with easy access to the rest of the city. The bedrooms are large and clean with a kitchenette. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable - despite jetlag I slept very soundly! The bathroom was the only disappointment - very small and somewhat shabby, although by no means dirty. Breakfast was fine - there is the usual selection of fruit, bagels, muffins etc together with some hot food which varied from morning to morning. We didn't eat in the hotel - Boston has some great eating places and we didn't think this would be one of them. However, the terrace is the perfect place for an early evening drink overlooking the marina. Small gripe - we asked twice about public transport options into Boston if we didn't want to walk across the bridge and were told there were none. It was only towards the end of our stay that we found out there was a bus that went from just over the road, straight into downtown Boston. A little disappointing having wasted money on taxis.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Boston!”
Reviews.Author: OPGatoRx
Reviews.Content: I used the Marriott website to book our 7-night trip to Boston. I debated between taking this hotel and another Residence Inn in Cambridge but ultimately decided on this one. The location was great because it was within a 10 minute-walk to the North Station metro stop or the water ferry that was also part of the public transportation system (BIG HINT: at the airport buy the weekly pass that gives you unlimited rides, then take the Metro line to the Aquarium, and from there take the water ferry to Charlestown. More interesting than a cab anyday.) The hotel is just off the Freedom Trail, and is walking distance to good restaurants, a supermarket (but it looks a little run down, especially if you are used to the Publix Supermarkets here in Florida), and a small branch of the public library with free internet. It is beside an office park and condos --- not in a typical touristy area but that works for some folks! Don't bother eating at its restaurant because you can get better food at the same price (North End Italian and Todd English's restaurants are walking distance), although the buffet breakfast is okay (comes with the room). The rooms come with a full-size fridge, a cooktop, and a microwave so you can always heat up any leftovers. We had a king-sized bed and a sleeper sofa; comfortable for a couple and a pre-teen but probably cramped if you had 2 kids or an older child. The swimming pool was tiiinnny --- but then who comes to Boston to swim when you're from Florida? We had problems with our shower but the maintenance guy came and fixed it right away. When you ask for your room see if you can get a higher floor facing AWAY from the bridge, so you get a view of the water and don't have to deal with road noise. I wouldn't mind staying here again but would like to suggest that their reception staff get to know the area so that they can give clear, concise directions to guests. Marriott should make it mandatory for all their hotels to have a printed fact sheet on hand with important info (directions using public transportation if available, location of nearby churches, supermarkets, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Water View & Comfortable Suite”
Reviews.Author: EllenAdena
Reviews.Content: It was well worth it to book months in advance to get one of the few two bedroom, two bathroom suites (Suite 500). My husband and I were quite comfortable in the king size bed and our son found his queen size bed to be perfect for him. Both bedrooms had decent size private bathrooms. The view from the master bedroom was wonderful! We looked out at the water and at night we could see the Boston skyline beautifully illuminated. From the living room we also had a water view and could see the masts of the Constitution. We stayed at the Inn for a week and we would agree with other reviewer's comments about the breakfast buffet becoming uninteresting after a few mornings. Even though it lacked variety, it was a perfectly adequate buffet. The location was good for visiting Bunker Hill, the Constitution and for taking the water ferry to the Aquarium and the areas of the Freedom Trail near Long Wharf. In order to go to a game or a tour at Fenway Park, you should plan to leave adequate time to cross the bridge and walk to the "T". We recommend dinner on the roof deck at the Tavern on the Water Restaurant (1/2 mile from the Inn) for both the seafood and the water views. We also recommend the Cape Anne Whale Watching tours out of Gloucester rather than the tours out of Boston. We hung out with the humpbacks for an amazing and magical hour and a half! It was the highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Late-Travellers
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel. We stayed for two nights and we had a suite with a king sized bed. The bedroom was spacious, a good size bathroom, an eat-in kitchen and living room all exceptionally clean. There were two things that made this hotel the best 1.the bed and 2.the complementary breakfast. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept in. The mattress was so comfortable and the bedding heavenly. Breakfast consisted of juices, fruit, oatmeal, cereal, toast, waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage - all fresh and cooked perfectly. We had breakfast on Saturday and Sunday mornings and although both days were busy full choices were available. We had a room overlooking the water with a beautiful view of the Boston skyline. The front desk staff gave us great advice about how to get to the city centre. There is a ferry service from the Navy yard 10 minutes walk from the hotel which takes you to the market area in the city . We were there at 8am on Saturday but the ferry starts at 10am on weekend days. We decided to walk across the bridge to the city â€“ about 20 minutes and easy to find since the hotel is almost on the Freedom Trail. On the day we arrived we ate at the hotel cafe which was OK â€“ staff were friendly and efficient. Overall a great hotel, helpful pleasant staff â€“ we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast, Great Staff & Dog Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: lbr8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for about a week and booked a suite with a king sized bed. The room was a good size for 2 people with an 80lb dog; there was a decent sized bedroom with a small bathroom, an eat-in kitchen and living room with dog-friendly couch, TV and desk. The best part about the hotel was the complimentary breakfast every morning. And this isn't just run of the mill continental breakfast, it's a breakfast buffet - fruit, oatmeal, pancakes, cereal, toast, waffles...they even made my husband special eggs every morning (a small tip goes a long way). The staff was super friendly and tended to any needs we had. It's in a great location in Charlestown, right next to a dog park and good restaurants. The cafe food wasn't all that great and room service was even worse, but I'd still recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hair, hair everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: TeddyBear03
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Boston this Monday and Tuesday for business and my corporate travel agent booked this hotel for me as it is only a few minutes from our office by taxi. I admit I didn't have high expectations from a Residence Inn, but this one was even lower than I expected. To be fair, I'll point out that the staff was very nice and the complimentary breakfast was a nice touch. However, I have to comment on the cleanliness of my room. There was someone else's hair EVERYWHERE! In the tub, on the tissue dispenser, on the floor by the sink, on the couch, and I'm afraid to imagine where else. I didn't complain because I was too tired from travelling, but I wouldn't stay here again. Additionally, the room service menu was horrific. They only offer soups and sandwiches and the BLT I ordered arrived sans mayo. I picked at my dry sandwich and refused to take my socks off for fear of getting someone's hair on my feet. *shudder* I didn't get a good night's sleep at all...they gave me a HAIR with a room around it!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Beds!”
Reviews.Author: sammylynn
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, quiet and perfectly clean. However, the very best part and the most important part was the bed...it was outstanding! The mattress itself was so comfortable and the bedding, including the pillows were awesome. I am so tired of really nice hotels with beds that are so hard you can hardly sleep, that I was getting to the point of not wanting to travel much. But thank you Marriott....the beds were a dream and Marriott has become my hotel of choice from now on!! Also, the location was great, and the breakfast was delicious and far exceeded our expectations. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoBos
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. After having read some of the reviews, we were a little worried about staying over the weekend (noise), having worn or dirty linens and finding a place to eat. But our fears were unfounded. The hotel is clean, bright and beautiful. The front desk staff was friendly and immediately offered us any help we might need. We were lucky enough to get a room at the end of the hallway with great views of the water, boats, bridges and Boston skyline. Wonderful sunrise/sunset views and, surprise, a window that opened to let in some of the fresh air. The food at the hotel cafe is great and there are several wonderful restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel as well. I recommend the Warren Tavern and, if you're interested in watching Patriots football, the Ironside Grille. Otherwise, a mere 15-20 minute leisurely stroll over the bridge gets you into downtown Boston where restaurants and shopping abound! (Note though that, for some portion of the bridge, you're walking only on steel grates over the river. That is, don't look down!) The hotel was quiet and pleasant. We had drinks in the lounge every evening on comfortable chairs next to the fireplace. The bartender and waitresses were efficient and friendly. We liked having the option of having the room cleaned daily or not. On the days the maids cleaned, everything was vacuumed, scrubbed and spotless. They even ran the dishwasher and cleaned the microwave while we were out. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It's a little pricey to those of us who don't travel all that often, but relatively inexpensive by Boston's standards and worth every penny. It was tough to leave and we'll be returning to this hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value”
Reviews.Author: gb293
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, on the waterfront beside the Freedom Trail and 10 minutes walk from downtown (don't try to drive in Boston). Also close to the USS Constitution and near to good restuarants in Charlestown (I recommend Olive). Only problem is the directions, which are useless and Boston is a city without any roadsigns, so we eventually found it by chance! Suites are clean and comfortable with good views. Buffet breakfast a bit of a scrum, though.

Reviews.Title: “great location to see the sights”
Reviews.Author: memberbeware
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location to launch a sightseeing tour with the family and as previous reviews stated - the ferry is < 10min walk away (note the first boat starts at 10am on weekends) & goes straight to the aquarium & the grocer is about 10 min up a different road as well. We stayed in a 2 bed suite - didn't have a view of the harbour (which is lovely) - had a view of the interesting bridge with many trucks, trains, cranes - a hit with our toddler. The USS Constitution ship & museum nearby were also highlights of our stay. We managed to catch 'robot wars' at the science museum staged by MIT teams - little robot teams playing an aggressive soccer tourney & the great lightning/thunderstorm show in the electricity hall. Breakfast at the hotel was extensive (& was best brought up to the room), the kids had fun in the swimming pool & whirlpool (although the pool bottom was soiled with dirt the first night), the fitness room had a good array of treadmills with a view of the harbour, there was only one tiny wastebasket in the suite & it would have been nice to have a small bottle of dishsoap & a scrub pad ( as many other residence inns/suites provide) - the pots & pans were worn & had blackened bottoms (ie. how to remove without a proper scrub pad? & no the maids do not do dishes), laundry rooms are not available on even numbered floors (except possibly the 8th) despite the sign on the 6th floor point to a guest laundry (yep, tried to enter someone else's room - it said laundry this way) - the larger suites are at the end of the hallways & if you're really lucky it looks like you can have a large suite right by the elevator, across from the laundry room or mechanical room but with a view of the harbour on an odd numbered floor ending in a 00 & here's a tip - a fellow across at the public parkade told me where to park for free - there's a small strip of parking for about 20 - 30 cars between the hotel & the bridge (yep we could see ourcar directly below from our room) which is public parking. When I asked at the front desk - they confirmed this 'sotto voiced' - that yes it's free & yes you can leave your car there as long as you like. It seemed quite safe & sought after judging by the number of higher end SUVs cruising about nipping in looking for a spot. Don't park in front of the doors which say don't park here & don't park on the crossed strips which say parking prohibited - a yellow warning tag will appear on your shield.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and clean hotel with a great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: DriftwoodNL
Reviews.Content: We arrived direct from the airport and recieved excellent service from the very start. The twin room we had was very spacious and had a very useful small kitchenette, with microwave, dishwasher and small stove The breakfast buffet was very busy with a long que, but worth the wait and had a good selection. Location is good, with many of the Boston tours stopping just outside. USS Constallation is within walking distance I would stay at this hotel again

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott Residence Inn Boston Harbor on Tudor Wharf
HotelInfo.Address: 34-44 Charles River Avenue, Boston, MA 02129
